Title: Lower prices brought lower profits in 1Q16
Headline: We predicted 1Q16 would be complicated for some companies based on our calculations of what Brent needed to be for them to break even.  Still all the companies in our study reported positive EBITDA, at least after adjusting for impairment charges.
Article: We predicted 1Q16 would be complicated for some companies based on our calculations of what Brent needed to be for them to break even.  Still all the companies in our study reported positive EBITDA, at least after adjusting for impairment charges.

Title: Natural gas prices turn downwards
Headline: In a dramatic shift over just a few weeks, the rain brought back Colombia’s hydro resources, the halted Guatapé plant started working again and thermal generators slashed their natural gas purchases. Now paired with a global surplus of gas, low prices make some of Colombia’s strategic projects, especially offshore, look uncertain.
Article: In a dramatic shift over just a few weeks, the rain brought back Colombia’s hydro resources, the halted Guatapé plant started working again and thermal generators slashed their natural gas purchases. Now paired with a global surplus of gas, low prices make some of Colombia’s strategic projects, especially offshore, look uncertain.

Title: Ecopetrol secures US$300M loan from Canadian agency
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) signed a US$300M loan with the Export Development Canada (EDC) agency, which it says meets half of its financing goal for 2016 and demonstrates the continued trust that the market has in its operation.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) signed a US$300M loan with the Export Development Canada (EDC) agency, which it says meets half of its financing goal for 2016 and demonstrates the continued trust that the market has in its operation.

Title: Environmental Summary: Ecopetrol buries CCL pipeline
Headline: After an intense discussion between the government, the U´WA indigenous people and Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), the NOC has agreed to burry a portion of the Coveñas/Calo Limón pipeline due to environmental and tribal concerns. This and other environmental stories in our periodic summary.
Article: After an intense discussion between the government, the U´WA indigenous people and Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), the NOC has agreed to burry a portion of the Coveñas/Calo Limón pipeline due to environmental and tribal concerns. This and other environmental stories in our periodic summary.

Title: CSR Summary: Hiring ex-combatants
Headline: Equion Energy received accolades for a program in which it hired demobilized combatants as part of a transitional initiative. This and other Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) related news in our periodic summary.
Article: Equion Energy received accolades for a program in which it hired demobilized combatants as part of a transitional initiative. This and other Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) related news in our periodic summary.

Title: Geopark wants company for its exploration
Headline: Geopark (NYSE:GPRK) will explore “every piece” of its Llanos 34 block, but does not want to stop there. Its Colombia director Marcela Vaca gave details on its exploration activities, and that it has interest from larger operators and investment funds to form joint ventures.
Article: Geopark (NYSE:GPRK) will explore “every piece” of its Llanos 34 block, but does not want to stop there. Its Colombia director Marcela Vaca gave details on its exploration activities, and that it has interest from larger operators and investment funds to form joint ventures.

Title: Only 20 rigs working in March
Headline: The Association of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) reported one of its biggest drops yet in the use of rigs during March 2016, and authorities urge greater focus on expanding reserves and exploratory activity. But to do so there are several critical obstacles that must be addressed.
Article: The Association of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) reported one of its biggest drops yet in the use of rigs during March 2016, and authorities urge greater focus on expanding reserves and exploratory activity. But to do so there are several critical obstacles that must be addressed.

Title: What is next for Pacific?
Headline: Pacific E&P posted a US$901M loss in the first quarter of 2016 and saw its production fall as well. In its earnings statement issued on May 13th, management seemed set on accepting a restructuring deal from Catalyst Capital.
Article: Pacific E&P posted a US$901M loss in the first quarter of 2016 and saw its production fall as well. In its earnings statement issued on May 13th, management seemed set on accepting a restructuring deal from Catalyst Capital.

Title: USO cuddles up to new Labor Minister
Headline: The USO said that the new Labor Minister Clara López will allow for a dialogue between the ministry and the union to systematically discuss worker issues.
Article: The USO said that the new Labor Minister Clara López will allow for a dialogue between the ministry and the union to systematically discuss worker issues.

Title: Ecopetrol’s LOB results: Transport stronger, E&P weaker
Headline: The dramatically different margins between Transport and Ecopetrol’s other Lines of Business means the profit shift continues. Although E&P and Refining represent nearly 80% of revenues, they represent less than 40% of EBITDA.
Article: The dramatically different margins between Transport and Ecopetrol’s other Lines of Business means the profit shift continues. Although E&P and Refining represent nearly 80% of revenues, they represent less than 40% of EBITDA.

Title: ACP head blasts eco-protests
Headline: The president of the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) Francisco Lloreda lashed out against rising environmental and citizen protests against oil activities, which he says have become a free pass to extort and pressure the industry in Colombia.
Article: The president of the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) Francisco Lloreda lashed out against rising environmental and citizen protests against oil activities, which he says have become a free pass to extort and pressure the industry in Colombia.

Title: Meta Governor calls for shift away from oil
Headline: The Meta Governor Marcela Amaya insisted that the department must shift its economic pillars away from oil and instead focus on tourism and agriculture. She formed a special committee to study employment.
Article: The Meta Governor Marcela Amaya insisted that the department must shift its economic pillars away from oil and instead focus on tourism and agriculture. She formed a special committee to study employment.

Title: Canacol’s bet on gas paying off
Headline: Canacol Energy’s (TSX:CNE) strategic direction towards greater gas production helped it defy the general trends of its peer: Netbacks and revenues rose, costs fell, and it even reported a profit for the first quarter of 2016.
Article: Canacol Energy’s (TSX:CNE) strategic direction towards greater gas production helped it defy the general trends of its peer: Netbacks and revenues rose, costs fell, and it even reported a profit for the first quarter of 2016.

Title: Senate criticism for plan to import ethanol, Biofuels refinery
Headline: A decree that would lift restrictions to import ethanol has been criticized by Senators and the biofuels industry association, as were the delays and overruns at Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) biofuel refinery, which is still under construction.
Article: A decree that would lift restrictions to import ethanol has been criticized by Senators and the biofuels industry association, as were the delays and overruns at Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) biofuel refinery, which is still under construction.

Title: MinMinas Arce insists 1mmbd is the goal
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy Germán Arce says that the government has maintained its goal of one million barrels of crude per day, despite the industry’s challenges and falling output, and said investors need clear signs and consistency in the oil industry.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy Germán Arce says that the government has maintained its goal of one million barrels of crude per day, despite the industry’s challenges and falling output, and said investors need clear signs and consistency in the oil industry.

Title: Equion stays out of the red
Headline: Equion Energy president María Victoria Riaño credited cost cutting measures and efficiencies for helping maintain the company’s financial performance and production, allowing it to beat the expectations of its two shareholders Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and Repsol (MSE:REP) and deliver dividends worth US$190M in 2015.
Article: Equion Energy president María Victoria Riaño credited cost cutting measures and efficiencies for helping maintain the company’s financial performance and production, allowing it to beat the expectations of its two shareholders Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and Repsol (MSE:REP) and deliver dividends worth US$190M in 2015.

Title: CSR Summary: Protests for local hiring
Headline: In Orito, Cartagena, Yopal and Puerto Gaitán protests and conflicts over local hiring have escalated as jobs with the oil industry shrink.
Article: In Orito, Cartagena, Yopal and Puerto Gaitán protests and conflicts over local hiring have escalated as jobs with the oil industry shrink.

Title: USO calls for Reficar explanations in Senate debate
Headline: USO president Cesar Loza participated in the recent debate in Colombia’s senate on the overruns suffered in the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar), and warned again that there is an alleged plot to privatize Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC).
Article: USO president Cesar Loza participated in the recent debate in Colombia’s senate on the overruns suffered in the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar), and warned again that there is an alleged plot to privatize Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC).

Title: Rising tide lifts (almost) all boats
Headline: Higher oil prices definitely lifted the spirits of Colombia-committed E&P companies and their shareholders felt the same euphoria.
Article: Higher oil prices definitely lifted the spirits of Colombia-committed E&P companies and their shareholders felt the same euphoria.

Title: Acacías POT means trouble for CPO-9
Headline: A municipal ordinance plan (POT) looks to restrict oil activities in order to protect local water sources, and this has led to a series of court actions and accusations. The decision could end up affecting production at Ecopetrol’s CPO-9 block.
Article: A municipal ordinance plan (POT) looks to restrict oil activities in order to protect local water sources, and this has led to a series of court actions and accusations. The decision could end up affecting production at Ecopetrol’s CPO-9 block.

Title: ANH reports a spike in block related transactions
Headline: The National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) says that it has detected a significant increase in the buying and selling of E&P blocks, provoked by the fall in oil prices.
Article: The National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) says that it has detected a significant increase in the buying and selling of E&P blocks, provoked by the fall in oil prices.

Title: Ecopetrol shuffles board of directors
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has reorganized its board of directors, with the former Colombian ambassador to Venezuela Carlos Cure taking the role of president, replacing the former Minister of Defense Luis Fernando Ramírez.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has reorganized its board of directors, with the former Colombian ambassador to Venezuela Carlos Cure taking the role of president, replacing the former Minister of Defense Luis Fernando Ramírez.

Title: Reficar scandal hits full stride in Senate hearing
Headline: Recommendations for contractors with inflated prices, a passing of blame between Presidents Juan Manuel Santos and Alvaro Uribe and accusations of prostitutes winning contracts have taken the scandal surrounding the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) to an all new level.
Article: Recommendations for contractors with inflated prices, a passing of blame between Presidents Juan Manuel Santos and Alvaro Uribe and accusations of prostitutes winning contracts have taken the scandal surrounding the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) to an all new level.

Title: Ecopetrol back to profits in 1Q16
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) once again posted a profit in the first quarter of 2016 of CoP$363B (US$123.7M), as its transport business benefits its bottom line, coupled with cost cutting and a favorable exchange rate.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) once again posted a profit in the first quarter of 2016 of CoP$363B (US$123.7M), as its transport business benefits its bottom line, coupled with cost cutting and a favorable exchange rate.

Title: Crude theft surpasses costs of pipeline attacks
Headline: While the number of attacks on the Coveñas/Caño Limón pipeline has fallen dramatically, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is facing the high cost of illegal valves and pipeline theft.
Article: While the number of attacks on the Coveñas/Caño Limón pipeline has fallen dramatically, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is facing the high cost of illegal valves and pipeline theft.

Title: ECP revamping contracting strategy
Headline: Facing mounting criticism for cost overruns and poor contracting practices, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said the NOC is implementing a new strategy for how it purchases goods and services and manages its projects.
Article: Facing mounting criticism for cost overruns and poor contracting practices, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said the NOC is implementing a new strategy for how it purchases goods and services and manages its projects.

Title: Caquetá oil activity grows, suspicions too
Headline: A congressional representative from Caquetá allege that with growing E&P activity, the oil industry has intimidated the local population into accepting its presence and taken advantage of the unmet needs of the community to gain traction for potentially damaging projects.
Article: A congressional representative from Caquetá allege that with growing E&P activity, the oil industry has intimidated the local population into accepting its presence and taken advantage of the unmet needs of the community to gain traction for potentially damaging projects.

Title: Not finishing the month on a good trend
Headline: This week, we recorded the highest number of guerrilla-initiated incidents since last July. And they included the first large-scale attack on the Coveñas / Caño-Limón pipeline in some time. This will not be good for the peace process with the ELN nor for May production results.
Article: This week, we recorded the highest number of guerrilla-initiated incidents since last July. And they included the first large-scale attack on the Coveñas / Caño-Limón pipeline in some time. This will not be good for the peace process with the ELN nor for May production results.

Title: USO ready to receive Rubiales Field
Headline: The USO said that it is ready for Rubiales field to be reverted to Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and discarded any notions that Pacific E&P workers affiliated with rival union UTEM would keep their jobs.
Article: The USO said that it is ready for Rubiales field to be reverted to Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and discarded any notions that Pacific E&P workers affiliated with rival union UTEM would keep their jobs.

Title: The problem is not the price

Title: US$50 oil looking closer. Then what?
Headline: Brent finished the month of April, 2016 at US$47.37 and briefly was even over US$48 during Friday’s trading. Prices are now back to where they were in late October.
Article: Brent finished the month of April, 2016 at US$47.37 and briefly was even over US$48 during Friday’s trading. Prices are now back to where they were in late October.

Title: Reficar could have been worse, says Gutiérrez
Headline: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) former president Javier Gutiérrez defended his actions involving the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) while at the helm of the NOC, and said without the controls he enacted, the cost could have been worse.
Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) former president Javier Gutiérrez defended his actions involving the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) while at the helm of the NOC, and said without the controls he enacted, the cost could have been worse.

Title: Ecopetrol could be sold like Isagén: USO president
Headline: USO president Cézar Loza warned that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry and its board of directors have a plan to dismember the NOC and sell it off like the government did with energy producer Isagén.
Article: USO president Cézar Loza warned that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry and its board of directors have a plan to dismember the NOC and sell it off like the government did with energy producer Isagén.

Title: Environmental Summary: An unfortunate honor

Article: Before the controversy surrounding the environmental license of Hupecol in La Macarena emerged Colombia had already received global attention for being a leader in the number of environmentally related conflicts, second only to India.

Title: Fracking as an incentive?

Title: Acipet warns on stigmatizing the oil industry
Headline: The Colombian Association of Oil Engineers (ACIPET) issued a statement regarding the reversal of Hupecol’s environmental license in La Macarena, and warned of a growing stigmatism of the oil industry and its activities. The result is heightened legal uncertainty and a lack of respect for the industry’s professionals.
Article: The Colombian Association of Oil Engineers (ACIPET) issued a statement regarding the reversal of Hupecol’s environmental license in La Macarena, and warned of a growing stigmatism of the oil industry and its activities. Article: Casanare congressional representative Luis Hernando Otálora has reminded his constituents to have some restraint when making requests for the oil industry, focusing on local hiring for goods and services.

Title: Ecopetrol continues in “crisis mode”
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said that the firm does not see short term relief in the price of crude, and that it will continue “in crisis mode” for the foreseeable future, even for the next five years.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said that the firm does not see short term relief in the price of crude, and that it will continue “in crisis mode” for the foreseeable future, even for the next five years.

Title: Context is everything

Article: Recently I found myself in Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA) explaining the impact of lower oil prices to an audience of telecom managers, the vast majority of them Saudis.

Title: Production falling because of lack of development drilling
Headline: Last week’s announcement of 916 mbd for March production was a shocker but MinMinas said nothing about why it happened. Virtually the next day, April 22, 2016, the ANH published field level detail for January and February (but not, unfortunately, March).
Article: Last week’s announcement of 916 mbd for March production was a shocker but MinMinas said nothing about why it happened. Virtually the next day, April 22, 2016, the ANH published field level detail for January and February (but not, unfortunately, March).

Title: USO says anti-fracking stance causing retaliation
Headline: The USO said that its actions to oppose fracking through marches and to demand the government ban the process has made it the target of the national police and it has sounded an urgent alarm for greater protection.
Article: The USO said that its actions to oppose fracking through marches and to demand the government ban the process has made it the target of the national police and it has sounded an urgent alarm for greater protection.

Title: State Council sends ECP injunction back to lower court
Headline: The State Council ruled against Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and said that an administrative ruling that stemmed from a public referendum against oil activities in Tauramena was not its business, and rather it should be decided by a different court. Local press have labeled it as a win for the residents opposed to exploration and production activities.
Article: The State Council ruled against Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and said that an administrative ruling that stemmed from a public referendum against oil activities in Tauramena was not its business, and rather it should be decided by a different court. Local press have labeled it as a win for the residents opposed to exploration and production activities.

Title: Work groups formed to address La Cira Infantas conflict
Headline: Authorities and the El Centro settlement have agreed to form six work groups to talk local hiring, and protestors have lifted blockades of La Cira Infantas in Santander.
Article: Authorities and the El Centro settlement have agreed to form six work groups to talk local hiring, and protestors have lifted blockades of La Cira Infantas in Santander.

Title: La Macarena backlash continues
Headline: It took only a matter of days before public backlash surrounding the awarding of an environmental license near La Macarena, Meta had boiled to the point where public officials, even the President, were offering explanations and suspending licences. But the revelations and consequences continue to file in.
Article: It took only a matter of days before public backlash surrounding the awarding of an environmental license near La Macarena, Meta had boiled to the point where public officials, even the President, were offering explanations and suspending licences. Title: Offshore regulation starting to take shape
Headline: A few years ago, it seems that there was an oil conference every other week in Colombia. Low oil prices killed that trend but, considering its longer time frame (relatively unaffected by current price woes), offshore is the new ‘belle of the ball’ and so there is a flurry of related events.
Article: A few years ago, it seems that there was an oil conference every other week in Colombia. Low oil prices killed that trend but, considering its longer time frame (relatively unaffected by current price woes), offshore is the new ‘belle of the ball’ and so there is a flurry of related events.

Title: Gas keeps looking better
Headline: Last week we updated our estimates of netback and Production and Transport costs for crude oil. This week we look at gas and although the sample size is much smaller, gas widened its advantage over crude oil in terms of netback.
Article: Last week we updated our estimates of netback and Production and Transport costs for crude oil. This week we look at gas and although the sample size is much smaller, gas widened its advantage over crude oil in terms of netback.

Title: USO calls on government to revoke license in La Macarena

Article: The USO has jumped into the controversy surrounding the environmental license of Hupecol in La Macarena, warning of the damage which could occur from granting licenses like these.

Title: Santos orders authorities to review pipeline rates

Article: Following on his order to study tax breaks for the oil industry, President Juan Manuel Santos has now called on sector entities to study a reduction in pipeline rates to boost the industry’s financial standing.

Title: Echeverry sits down with Barrancabermeja authorities
Headline: Repeated calls for action from national authorities from Barrancabermeja politicians and residents earned them a meeting with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry. The NOC chief did not budge on decisions to not modernize the city’s refinery, but said it remains a strategic asset for the firm.
Article: Repeated calls for action from national authorities from Barrancabermeja politicians and residents earned them a meeting with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry. The NOC chief did not budge on decisions to not modernize the city’s refinery, but said it remains a strategic asset for the firm.

Title: US$45 barrel price needed to reactivate exploration
Headline: Although there has been a slight recovery of oil prices to the high US$30 range, analysts believe that Colombian operators need prices at US$45 or higher to reactivate stalled exploration activity.
Article: Although there has been a slight recovery of oil prices to the high US$30 range, analysts believe that Colombian operators need prices at US$45 or higher to reactivate stalled exploration activity.

Title: More details on UPME gas pipeline plan

Article: The Energy and Mining Planning Unit (UPME) has been moving forward with plans to tender the expansion of gas pipelines to improve the supply of the gas, and now details on the organization of the eventual network have emerged as well.

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has opened its application process to accept university and technical students for company internships, and a university scholarship program from Gases de Occidente shows off some of its results. These and other Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) stories in our periodic summary.

Title: Colombian oil price offset to Brent holds steady
Headline: With 4Q15 results now published for Colombia-committed, publicly traded companies, we could update this graph which shows the average offset or discount to Brent that these companies obtained. This shows that companies receive (on average) about US$10 below whatever Brent is in the quarter.
Article: With 4Q15 results now published for Colombia-committed, publicly traded companies, we could update this graph which shows the average offset or discount to Brent that these companies obtained. Article: On March 15, 2016 the Vice Minister of Mines María Isabel Ulloa presented Colombia’s first transparency report, elaborated according to the standards of the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI).

Title: E&P companies drop direct costs 27% in 2015
Headline: The publicly listed companies that will give us enough information to calculate netback have reported for 4Q15 and so we update our quarterly and annual graphs. The good news is that Production and Transport costs dropped 27% in 2015 (on average).
Article: The publicly listed companies that will give us enough information to calculate netback have reported for 4Q15 and so we update our quarterly and annual graphs. The good news is that Production and Transport costs dropped 27% in 2015 (on average).

Title: Constitutional Court lifts suspension on Hocol operations in Meta
Headline: After an intervention from authorities and the community itself, the Constitutional Court decided to lift a suspension on production activities in the Ocelote-Guarrojo in Puerto Gaitán, Meta, since the suspension could cause more problem than it prevents.
Article: After an intervention from authorities and the community itself, the Constitutional Court decided to lift a suspension on production activities in the Ocelote-Guarrojo in Puerto Gaitán, Meta, since the suspension could cause more problem than it prevents.

Title: Campetrol insists seismic, exploration must increase

Article: The president of the Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) Rubén Darío Lizarralde again called on the government for a better response to the industry’s current situation and asked for additonal measures to bolster exploration activity.

Title: ACP calls for further and immediate action

Article: The Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) insisted that the government lower State Take on operators and take further measures to guarantee the industry’s competitiveness, because the only thing for certain, says the association, is that prices will go back up.

Title: Ecopetrol shareholder meeting left few happy
Headline: A sharp drop in attendance and calls of protest were two of the main takeaways from Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) annual shareholder meeting held last week. Minority shareholders protest as the board of directors vote to not pay dividends this year. The NOC says it needs a US$50/barrel fuel price to reactivate shuttered fields.
Article: A sharp drop in attendance and calls of protest were two of the main takeaways from Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) annual shareholder meeting held last week. Minority shareholders protest as the board of directors vote to not pay dividends this year. The NOC says it needs a US$50/barrel fuel price to reactivate shuttered fields.

Title: The widening royalty gap
Headline: The consequences of the fall in oil prices look more severe with each passing month, as producing municipalities have suffered a perfect storm of corruption, poor management, regulatory changes, dwindling royalties and high resident expectations.
Article: The consequences of the fall in oil prices look more severe with each passing month, as producing municipalities have suffered a perfect storm of corruption, poor management, regulatory changes, dwindling royalties and high resident expectations.

Title: Lack of MinMinas means fuel price stability
Headline: We always reserve this spot for our monthly rant about the government’s fuel price formula. New fuel prices are announced on or about the first of the month. But apparently because there is no real MinMinas (the minister in charge, María Lorena Gutiérrez, is only concerned with the electricity crisis), the ministry decided to maintain prices where they were in March. We take the opportunity to update our producer price index graphs.
Article: We always reserve this spot for our monthly rant about the government’s fuel price formula. New fuel prices are announced on or about the first of the month. But apparently because there is no real MinMinas (the minister in charge, María Lorena Gutiérrez, is only concerned with the electricity crisis), the ministry decided to maintain prices where they were in March. We take the opportunity to update our producer price index graphs.

Title: A lighter than air week

Title: USO says ECP firings violate rights
Headline: The USO said that a total of 10 workers have been fired by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) from the Barrancabermeja Refinery after participating in a strike on March 17th, which the union said violates the legitimate rights of workers to protest and puts labor stability at risk.
Article: The USO said that a total of 10 workers have been fired by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) from the Barrancabermeja Refinery after participating in a strike on March 17th, which the union said violates the legitimate rights of workers to protest and puts labor stability at risk.

Title: Casanare is Colombia’s largest producer of gas
Headline: Traditionally, Colombians have thought of their natural gas as coming from La Guajira.  Even when we started HCC in 2012, La Guajira represented 51% of gas production. But by 4Q15, that figure had dropped to 31%. Casanare is the new leader.
Article: Traditionally, Colombians have thought of their natural gas as coming from La Guajira.  Even when we started HCC in 2012, La Guajira represented 51% of gas production. But by 4Q15, that figure had dropped to 31%. Casanare is the new leader.

Title: Environmental Summary: Government to protect 100,000ha of páramos
Headline: The national government has set the limits of eight páramos, or high mountain tundra, to protect water sources which it says supply more than three million people. The protective order affects a total of 100,000 hectares of land in different parts of the country. This and other environmental stories in our periodic roundup.
Article: The national government has set the limits of eight páramos, or high mountain tundra, to protect water sources which it says supply more than three million people. The protective order affects a total of 100,000 hectares of land in different parts of the country. This and other environmental stories in our periodic roundup.

Title: Ecopetrol’s “Business Fabric” program sets an example

Article: Chevron (NYSE:CVX) unveils a well and delivers food in La Guajira, in a campaign that benefits local indigenous communities and also includes its employees to gather the funds. These and other Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) stories in our periodic summary.

Title: Colombia’s reserves are going down
Headline: Our last estimate of Colombia’s 2015 reserves and reserve life was made on March 7, 2016, before Pacific E&P (TSC:PRE) reported. We now have reports from companies representing 87% of 2014 reserves. Since these are the only companies we expect to report publicly, this is the best estimate base we are going to get.
Article: Our last estimate of Colombia’s 2015 reserves and reserve life was made on March 7, 2016, before Pacific E&P (TSC:PRE) reported. We now have reports from companies representing 87% of 2014 reserves. Since these are the only companies we expect to report publicly, this is the best estimate base we are going to get.

Title: Ecopetrol says production efficiencies paying off
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) said that its strategy to increase the efficiency of its operations, including renegotiated rates with suppliers, shortened drill times and new technology, allowed it to save CoP$1.08T (US$352M), which amounts to nearly half of its total 2015 savings.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) said that its strategy to increase the efficiency of its operations, including renegotiated rates with suppliers, shortened drill times and new technology, allowed it to save CoP$1.08T (US$352M), which amounts to nearly half of its total 2015 savings.

Title: USO claims Ecopetrol layoffs imminent
Headline: USO VP and communications secretary Edwin Palma warned media that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) will cut 2000 positions across the country, and that the NOC has already issued a voluntary separation plan to workers.
Article: USO VP and communications secretary Edwin Palma warned media that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) will cut 2000 positions across the country, and that the NOC has already issued a voluntary separation plan to workers.

Title: Where is oil production going?

Headline: Ecopetrol’s president Juan Carlos Echeverry offered a spirited defense of the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) and its modernization at the recent Congress of the Colombian Natural Gas Association (Naturgas), highlighting that despite the bad press, the project moves forward and is nearly 100% operational.
Article: Ecopetrol’s president Juan Carlos Echeverry offered a spirited defense of the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) and its modernization at the recent Congress of the Colombian Natural Gas Association (Naturgas), highlighting that despite the bad press, the project moves forward and is nearly 100% operational.

Title: US demand for Colombian crude declines
Headline: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) exports to the US dropped off at the end of 2015 according to the company’s latest financial report, matching a US trend to import less crude and derivatives.
Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) exports to the US dropped off at the end of 2015 according to the company’s latest financial report, matching a US trend to import less crude and derivatives.

Title: ANH chief wants to start Pacific offshore exploration
Headline: The president of the National Hydrocarbons Agency Mauricio de la Mora said that the entity is working to tender an offer of “multi-client” seismic activity to boost activity not just in Caribbean waters, but also in the waters of the Pacific.
Article: The president of the National Hydrocarbons Agency Mauricio de la Mora said that the entity is working to tender an offer of “multi-client” seismic activity to boost activity not just in Caribbean waters, but also in the waters of the Pacific.

Title: Only a quarter of drills in use in January

Article: A recent report from the Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) calls attention to the fact only one of every four drills in Colombia were in use in Colombia, and urged the government to do more to stimulate exploration.

Title: United for Ecopetrol campaign pounces on MinHacienda letter
Headline: A letter submitted to congress from the Finance Ministry (MinHacienda) detailing the government’s stake in Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and another 29 state owned firms sparked alarms form the recently launched “United for Ecopetrol” as proof the government plans to privatize the NOC. The ministry said it is a routine and legally mandated letter submitted each year.
Article: A letter submitted to congress from the Finance Ministry (MinHacienda) detailing the government’s stake in Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and another 29 state owned firms sparked alarms form the recently launched “United for Ecopetrol” as proof the government plans to privatize the NOC. The ministry said it is a routine and legally mandated letter submitted each year.

Title: Clamor for Barranca Refinery continues
Headline: Unwavered by a formal decision to suspend the modernization of the Barrancabermeja Refinery by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), city authorities and unions continue to call for the project. The refinery management has denied rumors that it is currently unsafe and defended the NOC’s priorities.
Article: Unwavered by a formal decision to suspend the modernization of the Barrancabermeja Refinery by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), city authorities and unions continue to call for the project. The refinery management has denied rumors that it is currently unsafe and defended the NOC’s priorities.

Title: Oil patents dropping in Colombia due to price drop
Headline: The number of registered patents in Colombia, an area where it has led many other regional producers, has fallen off since the start of the oil price crisis. The Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) warns that this will make the country less competitive in the near future.
Article: The number of registered patents in Colombia, an area where it has led many other regional producers, has fallen off since the start of the oil price crisis. The Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) warns that this will make the country less competitive in the near future.

Title: Yet another (relatively) bad week
Headline: Security incidents jumped sharply last week but as has been the case lately, the results felt worse qualitatively than quantitatively.
Article: Security incidents jumped sharply last week but as has been the case lately, the results felt worse qualitatively than quantitatively.

Title: ACP calls on Santos for new round of benefits

Article: During a three hour meeting in the presidential Palace, the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) presented a series of measures to President Juan Manuel Santos, which would lighten the fiscal load on the industry and review transportation costs, to boost the oil & gas industry.

Headline: The 19th Congress of the Colombian Natural Gas Association (Naturgas) provided the venue for a debate on the future of the natural gas industry and gas supply, with Naturgas assuring current problems are not a larger trend, while the Colombian Petroleum Association brought up concerns on Colombia’s self-sufficiency.
Article: The 19th Congress of the Colombian Natural Gas Association (Naturgas) provided the venue for a debate on the future of the natural gas industry and gas supply, with Naturgas assuring current problems are not a larger trend, while the Colombian Petroleum Association brought up concerns on Colombia’s self-sufficiency.

Title: Pacific rumors fly, posts 2015 loss
Headline: Pacific Exploration & Production (TSX:PRE) said that it grew production in 2015 but, like everyone else in the industry, impairment charges led it to post a loss of US$5.462B. A report in US financial media that the firm is reviewing buyer proposals has also fueled speculation on its future.
Article: Pacific Exploration & Production (TSX:PRE) said that it grew production in 2015 but, like everyone else in the industry, impairment charges led it to post a loss of US$5.462B. Title: USO says reasons for striking abound

Title: The challenges awaiting the new MinMinas

Title: Ecopetrol condemns violent protests in Coveñas

Title: Ecopetrol ends 2015 in the red

Title: USO marks 93 years

Article: The USO celebrated its 93rd birthday on February 10th and said that its past has been marked by defending Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), and also called the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) a failure which should be shuttered.

Title: Reserves at current prices less than five years, says Campetrol

Headline: Parex Resources (TSX:PXT) reported its 2P reserve assessment for 2015, and said that it grew its proved plus probable reserves by 19% year-over-year, to log net 2P reserves of 81.7Mmboe as of December 31, 2015.

Title: Court suspends oil activity in Orito

Title: The hyperbole of Reficar

Title: Getting the facts straight
Headline: There is no avoiding the discussion: these days we cannot talk to anyone either in or outside of the industry without someone asking “What will happen to Pacific?” We cannot answer that nor we will we speculate. But we can provide some facts and estimates that we think illuminate the risks to total Colombian production in a ‘doomsday scenario’.
Article: There is no avoiding the discussion: these days we cannot talk to anyone either in or outside of the industry without someone asking “What will happen to Pacific?” We cannot answer that nor we will we speculate. But we can provide some facts and estimates that we think illuminate the risks to total Colombian production in a ‘doomsday scenario’.

Title: JAC’s not happy with fall in oil prices either
Headline: The oil industry’s actions to mitigate the fall in oil prices has meant slashed budgets and laid havoc to the goods and services sector. Not even the infamous but powerful Community Action Comittees (JACs) have been left out of the consequences.

Title: What will happen with oil prices this low?

Title: High court strikes down fuel stabilization fund
Headline: A fund created in the tax reform last year which looks to guarantee stable fuel prices has been declared unconstitutional by Colombia’s Constitutional Court. The transportation industry says this will benefit consumers, while the government says it will study its options.
Article: A fund created in the tax reform last year which looks to guarantee stable fuel prices has been declared unconstitutional by Colombia’s Constitutional Court. The transportation industry says this will benefit consumers, while the government says it will study its options.

Title: USO names new president, board of directors
Headline: Cesar Loza has been voted in as the new president of the USO, and promised an action plan focused on defending the Barrancabermeja Refinery modernization project, observing the transition of the Rubiales Field and fighting against worker layoffs in the sector, among other objectives.
Article: Cesar Loza has been voted in as the new president of the USO, and promised an action plan focused on defending the Barrancabermeja Refinery modernization project, observing the transition of the Rubiales Field and fighting against worker layoffs in the sector, among other objectives.

Title: Looking below the headlines: Ecopetrol’s Line-of-Business Results
Headline: The headline on Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) results was that it made money while the rest of the industry lost. Inside Colombia, the comparison is unfair because it has no rivals with the same breadth and as the above graph shows, the Transport sector save the day.
Article: The headline on Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) results was that it made money while the rest of the industry lost. Inside Colombia, the comparison is unfair because it has no rivals with the same breadth and as the above graph shows, the Transport sector save the day.

Title: Continuing demand for heavy crude in the US
Headline: The battle over oil prices is a battle over production with Saudi Arabia saying it wants to regain US market share lost to higher-cost shale oil. But that is light oil and US refineries still need a significant supply of heavy crude due to the configuration of their plants. The graph shows that the US represents an increasing share of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) exports, at least over the last six quarters.
Article: The battle over oil prices is a battle over production with Saudi Arabia saying it wants to regain US market share lost to higher-cost shale oil. But that is light oil and US refineries still need a significant supply of heavy crude due to the configuration of their plants. The graph shows that the US represents an increasing share of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) exports, at least over the last six quarters.

Title: Uncertainty in the wake of gas price decision
Headline: The decision by the Ministry of Mines of Energy (MinMinas) to modify the formula used to figure natural gas prices on the Caribbean Coast has left few content. Proponents of the change now want more action, the gas industry says it threatens investment and observers comment on how it impacts long term projects.
Article: The decision by the Ministry of Mines of Energy (MinMinas) to modify the formula used to figure natural gas prices on the Caribbean Coast has left few content. Proponents of the change now want more action, the gas industry says it threatens investment and observers comment on how it impacts long term projects.

Title: ANIF sounds alarms on lack of exploration success
Headline: An absence of exploratory results from the hydrocarbons industry is likely to extend until 2017 warns the National Association of Financial Institutions (ANIF), and Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) results will continue to suffer despite production increases, representing a loss of between 1-2% of the GDP.
Article: An absence of exploratory results from the hydrocarbons industry is likely to extend until 2017 warns the National Association of Financial Institutions (ANIF), and Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) results will continue to suffer despite production increases, representing a loss of between 1-2% of the GDP.

Title: Ecopetrol focusing its investment abroad
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) held a shareholders meeting in Medellín and said that it would strengthen its exploration activities abroad, setting an investment goal per year of US$1.25B on average, destined for the Gulf of Mexico, Peru, Brazil and Colombia’s offshore blocks.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) held a shareholders meeting in Medellín and said that it would strengthen its exploration activities abroad, setting an investment goal per year of US$1.25B on average, destined for the Gulf of Mexico, Peru, Brazil and Colombia’s offshore blocks.

Title: MinMinas agrees to change gas formula, ACP irate
Headline: The Minister of Mines and Energy Tomás González said the government has agreed to link the natural gas price for the Caribbean coast to the WTI crude oil price index and to start infrastructure work to connect the region. Meanwhile the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) blasted the pricing modifications as a change of the rules, and questioned what would happen when WTI rises again.
Article: The Minister of Mines and Energy Tomás González said the government has agreed to link the natural gas price for the Caribbean coast to the WTI crude oil price index and to start infrastructure work to connect the region. Meanwhile the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) blasted the pricing modifications as a change of the rules, and questioned what would happen when WTI rises again.

Title: Gas Natural Fenosa says supply is assured
Headline: The Colombian country manager  of Gas Natural Fenosa, González Santos, said that the supply of natural gas is assured and the matter is “not so complicated”, but the country must be ready to import gas when the hydro-electric grid is short on water.
Article: The Colombian country manager  of Gas Natural Fenosa, González Santos, said that the supply of natural gas is assured and the matter is “not so complicated”, but the country must be ready to import gas when the hydro-electric grid is short on water.

Title: Ecopetrol profitable at US$30/barrel, says Echeverry
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said in a recent interview that the NOC’s cost cutting measures have been effective and its profits have fallen less than the global average due to the fall in oil prices. Even if the price of crude falls to US$30/barrel, and he says he will pray it does not, the company would remain profitable.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry said in a recent interview that the NOC’s cost cutting measures have been effective and its profits have fallen less than the global average due to the fall in oil prices. Even if the price of crude falls to US$30/barrel, and he says he will pray it does not, the company would remain profitable.

Title: Fuel prices fall again in December
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) announced fuel prices for December, and diesel registered a bigger drop than gasoline, which the ministry says is at its lowest level in five years.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) announced fuel prices for December, and diesel registered a bigger drop than gasoline, which the ministry says is at its lowest level in five years.

Title: USO holds election, awaits results
Headline: The USO held its annual election of its board of directors during its national assembly of delegates on November 26 and 27 and is in the process of validating the results.
Article: The USO held its annual election of its board of directors during its national assembly of delegates on November 26 and 27 and is in the process of validating the results.

Title: Oil prices and netbacks plumbing new depths
Headline: Well that could not last. After two straight months of increasing, prices fell again and we are now at a new low for past half-decade.
Article: Well that could not last. After two straight months of increasing, prices fell again and we are now at a new low for past half-decade.

Title: Oil companies push for government to make good on tax return
Headline: Through the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP), companies are calling on the government’s customs and taxes agency DIAN to fulfill tax returns on fiscal income prepaid to the authorities which was based on oil prices of US$80-90/barrel.
Article: Through the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP), companies are calling on the government’s customs and taxes agency DIAN to fulfill tax returns on fiscal income prepaid to the authorities which was based on oil prices of US$80-90/barrel.

Article: A mixed system for block auctions which includes a greater frequency of two a year and more flexibility in their rules is being drawn up the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH). Its board of directors is reviewing the plan.

Title: Oil production at center of case before Constitutional court

Title: Gran Tierra Energy ordered to pay US$2M to Ecopetrol
Headline: The Colombian State Council found that the firm Gran Tierra Energy Colombia (TSX: GTE) has failed to meet the terms of a contract with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and therefore owes the state oil firm CoP$6.2B (US$2M).
Article: The Colombian State Council found that the firm Gran Tierra Energy Colombia (TSX: GTE) has failed to meet the terms of a contract with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and therefore owes the state oil firm CoP$6.2B (US$2M).

Title: Environmental Summary: Energy sector contributes most to Colombian emissions

Title: The outlook for Ecopetrol’s small investors
Headline: Thousands of Colombians invested their savings in Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) following its market debut in 2007. Those that did not sell off at its peak have been left to watch their investment’s value shrink, and in early November the NOC’s stock fell below its IPO value on the Bogotá exchange. What options do these small investors have to recovery their lost value?
Article: Thousands of Colombians invested their savings in Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) following its market debut in 2007. Those that did not sell off at its peak have been left to watch their investment’s value shrink, and in early November the NOC’s stock fell below its IPO value on the Bogotá exchange. Title: ANH holds fair on regional hydrocarbons strategy

Title: Holding peace process hostage over gas prices

Article: GasThe conflict over natural gas prices on the Caribbean coast took a new turn when Senator Jose Name said he would lead a charge among Caribbean congressional leaders to vote against an eventual peace accord if the government does not ‘resolve’ gas rate hikes.

Title: Campetrol warns on dwindling reserves, ECP responds
Headline: The president of the Colombian Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) Rubén Darío Lizarralde warned attendees at an event in Barrancabermeja that Colombia’s proven reserves are enough to last for only six more years, and the current government strategy will not do much to change that. Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) then responded.
Article: The president of the Colombian Chamber of Oil Goods and Services (Campetrol) Rubén Darío Lizarralde warned attendees at an event in Barrancabermeja that Colombia’s proven reserves are enough to last for only six more years, and the current government strategy will not do much to change that. Title: Echeverry links exploration activity to state take
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry has in the past defended what others consider high taxes on oil companies, but in a recent report a national radio chain says he sees the nearly 70% state take as being a barrier to foreign investment, affecting in particular exploration wells.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Juan Carlos Echeverry has in the past defended what others consider high taxes on oil companies, but in a recent report a national radio chain says he sees the nearly 70% state take as being a barrier to foreign investment, affecting in particular exploration wells.

Title: USO holds Second National Assembly for Peace
Headline: The USO held its Second National Assembly for Peace, in which it said that its work in a post-conflict it would focus on mining-energy policy, regional development and “promoting the culture of peace”.
Article: The USO held its Second National Assembly for Peace, in which it said that its work in a post-conflict it would focus on mining-energy policy, regional development and “promoting the culture of peace”.

Title: Ecopetrol wraps up plant to lighten crudes
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it has finished a demonstration plant in Chichimene in the Meta Department which uses a technology to lighten heavy and extra heavy crudes, allowing them to be shipped in pipelines while cutting the company’s need to purchase naphtha as a diluent.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it has finished a demonstration plant in Chichimene in the Meta Department which uses a technology to lighten heavy and extra heavy crudes, allowing them to be shipped in pipelines while cutting the company’s need to purchase naphtha as a diluent.

Title: ECP field hand over to Hocol causing problems in Tolima
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is handing over three oil fields to its own subsidiary Hocol in Ortega, Tolima, which caused concern and even blockades by the local community.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is handing over three oil fields to its own subsidiary Hocol in Ortega, Tolima, which caused concern and even blockades by the local community.

Title: Ecopetrol loses 16,000 barrels a month due to theft

Article: Improvised, illegal and dangerous valves installed along Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) pipelines are causing it to lose a growing amount of crude, also resulting in risks of severe environmental damage.

Title: Ecopetrol treading water
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) can celebrate that unlike nearly all of its private industry peers it has been able to post a profit in the third quarter of 2015, but it has seen its production fall slightly, and its E&P business continues to post losses. This has been compensated by its refining business to some degree, while transportation income nearly doubled.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) can celebrate that unlike nearly all of its private industry peers it has been able to post a profit in the third quarter of 2015, but it has seen its production fall slightly, and its E&P business continues to post losses. This has been compensated by its refining business to some degree, while transportation income nearly doubled.

Title: DANE agrees on gas shortage

Title: Geopark: 85% of production viable with oil at US$25

Title: Controversy engulfs future of Rubiales workers

Title: Where are the benefits?

Headline: The National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) is preparing another set of regulatory changes, Agreement 05, which builds on past adjustments designed to make the sector more flexible in the new price scenario. Title: WTI, Brent margin shrinks, Ecopetrol imports light crude

Title: General Controller concerned with ICP audit and findings
Headline: The General Controller performed an audit of the Colombian Petroleum Institute (ICP), the research institute of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and found 15 administrative findings, two fiscal and four “disciplinary” cases in its contracts worth a total of CoP$1.072B (US$370,000). Questions on an unsuccessful building of a butterfly sanctuary were also raised.
Article: The General Controller performed an audit of the Colombian Petroleum Institute (ICP), the research institute of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and found 15 administrative findings, two fiscal and four “disciplinary” cases in its contracts worth a total of CoP$1.072B (US$370,000). Questions on an unsuccessful building of a butterfly sanctuary were also raised.

Title: June Farc OTA attack worst in Colombia’s history
Headline: The attack on the Transandino Pipeline (OTA) in June of this year has been labeled the worst in Colombia’s history due to the extensive environmental damage which occurred from the spilled oil. Four months on, the initial emergency measures are just now being concluded.
Article: The attack on the Transandino Pipeline (OTA) in June of this year has been labeled the worst in Colombia’s history due to the extensive environmental damage which occurred from the spilled oil. Four months on, the initial emergency measures are just now being concluded.

Title: 3Q15 shows 2Q15 was the ‘dead cat bounce’ in crude oil prices
Headline: After a brief ray of sunlight in 2Q15, reality – in the form of a slowdown in the Chinese economy – sent oil prices lower, lower even than they were in 1Q15. However, September showed some signs of improvement driven (unfortunately) by troubles in the Middle East and to some extent by evidence of lower US production.
Article: After a brief ray of sunlight in 2Q15, reality – in the form of a slowdown in the Chinese economy – sent oil prices lower, lower even than they were in 1Q15. Title: Price Impact: Where will the price go next?

Title: Big surprise: Reficar delayed again
Headline: At the end of November 2014, reports surfaced that the Cartagena Refinery would be functional in January 2015 and see its commercial launch in August 2015. But in Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) latest earning results, management said that once again, that timeframe will be pushed back.
Article: At the end of November 2014, reports surfaced that the Cartagena Refinery would be functional in January 2015 and see its commercial launch in August 2015. But in Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) latest earning results, management said that once again, that timeframe will be pushed back.

Title: Ecopetrol pulls out of the red
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) saw its revenues hit by the fall in oil prices, but managed to reverse losses felt in the final quarter of 2014, posting a consolidated net income of CoP$160B (US$67.32M) as production holds and margins in its transportation and refining businesses improve.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) saw its revenues hit by the fall in oil prices, but managed to reverse losses felt in the final quarter of 2014, posting a consolidated net income of CoP$160B (US$67.32M) as production holds and margins in its transportation and refining businesses improve.

Title: ANH looks to boost recovery factor

Title: CGR criticizes ANH for lacking studies on fracking
Headline: The General Comptroller’s (CGR) environmental delegate office said that the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) has exposed the environment and country to undue risks by not doing further studies into the impact of fracking before including blocks in the Colombia Round 2014. The CGR also announced it will be focusing more on the use of royalty funds and plans a series of audits and inspections in the second half of this year.
Article: The General Comptroller’s (CGR) environmental delegate office said that the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) has exposed the environment and country to undue risks by not doing further studies into the impact of fracking before including blocks in the Colombia Round 2014. The CGR also announced it will be focusing more on the use of royalty funds and plans a series of audits and inspections in the second half of this year.

Title: USO will not go on strike
Headline: Following a meeting between the USO oil workers union president Edwin Castaño and a number of government ministers, vice ministers and the head of the National Planning Department (DNP) Simon Gaviria, the union said that it would not hold an indefinite strike after Gaviria made statements that Ecopetrol would not be privatized.
Article: Following a meeting between the USO oil workers union president Edwin Castaño and a number of government ministers, vice ministers and the head of the National Planning Department (DNP) Simon Gaviria, the union said that it would not hold an indefinite strike after Gaviria made statements that Ecopetrol would not be privatized.

Title: Ecopetrol increased crude oil exports to the US in 4Q14
Headline: Despite the well-documented glut of oil in the US – which has (depending on viewpoint) contributed or caused the dramatic fall in oil prices since mid-2014 – Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) actually increased its exports to the US in 4Q14.
Article: Despite the well-documented glut of oil in the US – which has (depending on viewpoint) contributed or caused the dramatic fall in oil prices since mid-2014 – Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) actually increased its exports to the US in 4Q14.

Title: CSR Summary: Ecopetrol listed as CSR top ten, amidst protests
Headline: Ecopetrol makes top ten list for Colombian CSR while the company receives attacks for allegedly canceling the reconstruction of a Villavicencio school. These and other stories on Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) in our periodic summary.
Article: Ecopetrol makes top ten list for Colombian CSR while the company receives attacks for allegedly canceling the reconstruction of a Villavicencio school. These and other stories on Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) in our periodic summary.

Title: ANH confirms new president
Headline: Mauricio de la Mora has been confirmed as the new president of the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH), replacing Javier Betancourt and taking charge of the agency at a fragile moment for the industry.
Article: Mauricio de la Mora has been confirmed as the new president of the National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH), replacing Javier Betancourt and taking charge of the agency at a fragile moment for the industry.

Title: Equión suspends work at Floreña
Headline: Fed up with a persistent blockade at its Floreña wells and CDF, Equion has suspended all work at its Floreña A, I and T wells and construction work still being performed at the recently inaugurated Floreña CPF.
Article: Fed up with a persistent blockade at its Floreña wells and CDF, Equion has suspended all work at its Floreña A, I and T wells and construction work still being performed at the recently inaugurated Floreña CPF.

Title: Environmental Wrap: Ecopetrol touts investment, rejects lawsuit
Headline: Ecopetrol got some attention for its investment and spending on environmental matters, which totaled CoP$805B (US$317.9M) over the last five years. But the NOC also said it had nothing to do with a spill for which residents in Coveñas have filed a lawsuit. These and other environmental stories in our periodic wrap up.
Article: Ecopetrol got some attention for its investment and spending on environmental matters, which totaled CoP$805B (US$317.9M) over the last five years. But the NOC also said it had nothing to do with a spill for which residents in Coveñas have filed a lawsuit. These and other environmental stories in our periodic wrap up.

Title: The next step for Rubiales politics
Headline: The political forces that successfully swayed Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) board to not renew the association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) have moved on to the next step, that Ecopetrol operate the field directly, opening the door to the USO union to enter the field.
Article: The political forces that successfully swayed Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) board to not renew the association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) have moved on to the next step, that Ecopetrol operate the field directly, opening the door to the USO union to enter the field.

Title: After 24-hour stop, USO threatens indefinite strike
Headline: Fresh off a 24-hour strike on March 19, the USO said they will meet with Ecopetrol and government representatives on March 25, and then determine if they will continue with an indefinite strike as promised.
Article: Fresh off a 24-hour strike on March 19, the USO said they will meet with Ecopetrol and government representatives on March 25, and then determine if they will continue with an indefinite strike as promised.

Title: Price Impact: With challenges, come opportunities
Headline: Both national and local leaders have taken to talk of an opportunity to strengthen other sectors outside of oil and create a more diversified economy, and many planned projects, including a micro-refinery in Meta, will have to be reconsidered. These and others stories in our periodic review of the impact of the fall in oil prices.
Article: Both national and local leaders have taken to talk of an opportunity to strengthen other sectors outside of oil and create a more diversified economy, and many planned projects, including a micro-refinery in Meta, will have to be reconsidered. These and others stories in our periodic review of the impact of the fall in oil prices.

Title: MinMinas issues resolution to define royalty distribution on shared properties
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) is advancing with a resolution that would rework how territorial entities share royalties of projects on properties which overlap regional borders, introducing a new formula.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) is advancing with a resolution that would rework how territorial entities share royalties of projects on properties which overlap regional borders, introducing a new formula.

Title: UTEN looks to stay in Rubiales
Headline: The UTEN workers union which represents workers with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) has an uncertain future due to the decision of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to not renew its association contract with the Canadian operator for the Rubiales Field.
Article: The UTEN workers union which represents workers with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) has an uncertain future due to the decision of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to not renew its association contract with the Canadian operator for the Rubiales Field.

Title: Pacific Rubiales posts 2014 losses despite revenue increase
Headline: Pacific Rubiales (TSX: PRE) reported net losses amounting to US$1.3B in 2014 (impacted by an asset impairment charge), suspending its dividend as the fall in oil prices left a significant mark on the company’s financial results.
Article: Pacific Rubiales (TSX: PRE) reported net losses amounting to US$1.3B in 2014 (impacted by an asset impairment charge), suspending its dividend as the fall in oil prices left a significant mark on the company’s financial results.

Title: Cenit to increase capacity
Headline: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) transportation spin off Cenit is planning a series of investments of up to US$4B in total from 2014-2019 to increase its crude oil transport capacity to 1.4mmbd.
Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) transportation spin off Cenit is planning a series of investments of up to US$4B in total from 2014-2019 to increase its crude oil transport capacity to 1.4mmbd.

Title: Taking the long view of Rubiales field
Headline: The graph shows what has happened to production from Rubiales field since 2002. Meta Petroleum i.e. Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) took over operations of the field in mid-2006 when it was producing just under 10mbd by our estimates.
Article: The graph shows what has happened to production from Rubiales field since 2002. Meta Petroleum i.e. Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) took over operations of the field in mid-2006 when it was producing just under 10mbd by our estimates.

Title: Roads Review: Casanare works revised, Meta train moves forward
Headline: Casanare has CoP$35B (US$13.2M) in road infrastructure projects in the pipeline and an environmental alternative for a Meta train project has been authorized. These and other stories in our periodic roundup of road-related issues.
Article: Casanare has CoP$35B (US$13.2M) in road infrastructure projects in the pipeline and an environmental alternative for a Meta train project has been authorized. These and other stories in our periodic roundup of road-related issues.

Title: Gasnova says propane cut will have dire impact
Headline: The association of propane gas distributors Gasnova reiterated its alarms that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is taking measures to limit the supply of propane gas in Colombia to benefit its financial results, which it says will have a grave impact on the poorest populations in the country.
Article: The association of propane gas distributors Gasnova reiterated its alarms that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is taking measures to limit the supply of propane gas in Colombia to benefit its financial results, which it says will have a grave impact on the poorest populations in the country.

Title: ECP says cooperating on corruption investigation
Headline: The corruption case involving former Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) employees and a contract awarded to PetroTiger has arisen again after a new round of arrests, and the NOC says it is a victim and has been efficiently cooperating with the investigation.
Article: The corruption case involving former Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) employees and a contract awarded to PetroTiger has arisen again after a new round of arrests, and the NOC says it is a victim and has been efficiently cooperating with the investigation.

Title: Lawsuit filed against fuel price formula
Headline: The Network for Tax Justice has filed a lawsuit to anull the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) resolution that defines the formula used to determine the country´s fuel prices.
Article: The Network for Tax Justice has filed a lawsuit to anull the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) resolution that defines the formula used to determine the country´s fuel prices.

Title: USO says Rubiales decision “a positive step”
Headline: The USO welcomed the decision of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to not renew the Rubiales Field association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) saying that it was a result of years of social and political pressure. But the union was clear that it is just the first step.
Article: The USO welcomed the decision of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to not renew the Rubiales Field association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) saying that it was a result of years of social and political pressure. But the union was clear that it is just the first step.

Title: Price Impact: transportation, seismic, services taking big hit
Headline: The Colombia Chamber of Oil Goods & Services (Campetrol) estimates that as many as 15,000 workers with oil contractors have lost their jobs thus far due to the fall in oil prices, and that the cuts will likely continue.
Article: The Colombia Chamber of Oil Goods & Services (Campetrol) estimates that as many as 15,000 workers with oil contractors have lost their jobs thus far due to the fall in oil prices, and that the cuts will likely continue.

Title: Pacific without Rubiales
Headline: Finally ruling on one of the more controversial and uncertain scenarios facing the Colombian oil industry, Ecoeptrol (NYSE:EC) has said it would not renew its association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) for Colombia’s largest producing field, Rubiales.
Article: Finally ruling on one of the more controversial and uncertain scenarios facing the Colombian oil industry, Ecoeptrol (NYSE:EC) has said it would not renew its association contract with Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) for Colombia’s largest producing field, Rubiales.

Title: Biofuels suffering from low oil price
Headline: The low price of oil is putting Colombia’s biofuels industry and future investments for it at risk says the National Federation of Biofuels (Fedebiocombustibles), although Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) biofuel unit Bioenergy says it will move forward will an expansion of sugar cane crops for fuels and a long delayed plant.
Article: The low price of oil is putting Colombia’s biofuels industry and future investments for it at risk says the National Federation of Biofuels (Fedebiocombustibles), although Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) biofuel unit Bioenergy says it will move forward will an expansion of sugar cane crops for fuels and a long delayed plant.

Title: ECP says prepared for strike as USO sets date
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it has a contingency workforce and that a strike by the USO oil workers union would be illegal and could lead to dismissals. Meanwhile the union is preparing a 24 hours strike for March 19, which could be expanded into an indefinite one.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it has a contingency workforce and that a strike by the USO oil workers union would be illegal and could lead to dismissals. Meanwhile the union is preparing a 24 hours strike for March 19, which could be expanded into an indefinite one.

Article: Incident counts went up significantly this week to 33 but qualitatively we are still in the same ‘quieter’ period with respect to guerrilla-initiated activities.

Title: Environmental Wrap: Minimal drought this year, ANLA no show
Headline: The Casanare administrative court will inspect Mate Marrano wetlands after The National Environmental Licensing Agency (ANLA) did not show for a hearing, and authorities say that thus far Paz de Ariporo is not suffering from drought conditions like last year. These and other environmental stories in our periodic summary.

Title: PRE’s bet to keep Rubiales
Headline: Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) delivered a proposal which would keep it in the Rubiales field following the end of its association contract, offering a give and take to Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) based on its ability to improve secondary recovery, expand the number of wells and implement new technologies.
Article: Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) delivered a proposal which would keep it in the Rubiales field following the end of its association contract, offering a give and take to Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) based on its ability to improve secondary recovery, expand the number of wells and implement new technologies.

Title: Echeverry in as ECP president

Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) board of directors voted in the government’s official candidate for the role of company president. Former Finance Minister Juan Carlos Echeverry takes the wheel of the NOC at one of its most complex moments.

Title: Government converting Ecopetrol into its cash box, says USO

Article: With the naming of former Santos Finance Minister Juan Carlos Echeverry as the new president of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), the government planning to convert the NOC into a handy cash box to meet its immediate needs warned USO president Edwin Castaño.

Title: Better but still bad
Headline: The graph shows Ecopetrol’s attributed Net Income to its Refining and Petrochemicals line of business for the full year 2014 and prior years. The good news is that things are not as bad as last year. The bad news is fairly obvious: it still lost nearly US$450M.
Article: The graph shows Ecopetrol’s attributed Net Income to its Refining and Petrochemicals line of business for the full year 2014 and prior years. The good news is that things are not as bad as last year. The bad news is fairly obvious: it still lost nearly US$450M.

Title: Oil & Gas cluster planned for Casanare, Meta

Title: Another union joins the fray, USO teeters on strike

Article: The Central Workers Union (CUT) has entered the labor dispute generated as companies cut costs due to the fall in oil prices, and is promoting a strike of oil workers. Meanwhile the USO oil workers union has the member vote to strike, and promises that they will take action very soon.

Title: Gasnova warns on Ecopetrol plans to limit propane supply

Title: Price Impact: Local oil economies say the drop in sales is steep
Headline: Local commercial venders in Puerto Gaitán and Barrancabermeja are warning that already there is a steep drop off in their sales, as much as 80%, with the ability of contractors to pay their debts a rising concern. These and other stories in a weekly roundup following the impact of the fall of oil prices on the Colombian economy.

Title: Three regions want a refinery

Title: Politics Trump Economics – Inner Circle Weekly Newsletter for March 2, 2015

Article: This week laid bare one of the truths of policy in Colombia, (and plenty of other places of course): 9 times out of 10, politics will trump economics.

Title: Ecopetrol grows proven reserves by 5.7% in 2014
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) grew its P1 reserves to 2,084mmboe in 2014, an increase of 5.7% compared to the previous year. Growth mainly came from revisions in existing fields and its reserves/production ratio is now 8.6 years.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) grew its P1 reserves to 2,084mmboe in 2014, an increase of 5.7% compared to the previous year. Growth mainly came from revisions in existing fields and its reserves/production ratio is now 8.6 years.

Title: Government drops fuel prices ahead of schedule for March
Headline: In an apparent effort to avoid a truckers strike and ward off critics of its fuel pricing policy, the central government made a surprise announcement to cut both diesel and gasoline prices by CoP$300 (US$0.12), bringing gasoline to its lowest level in almost five years.
Article: In an apparent effort to avoid a truckers strike and ward off critics of its fuel pricing policy, the central government made a surprise announcement to cut both diesel and gasoline prices by CoP$300 (US$0.12), bringing gasoline to its lowest level in almost five years.

Title: Despite cost cutting, ECP keeps offshore on the table

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has deeply cut its 2015 Capex and wants to reduce its operational costs by 30% as well, but it will still destine US$200M to offshore development and drilling.

Title: Unions react to the crisis

Article: The reaction to the oil price crisis has serious implications for the estimated 120,000 workers in Colombia’s industry, and has received a countering reaction from some of the industry’s most prevalent unions.

Title: Another tax reform in the works?

Title: Ecopetrol secures loan to guarantee investment plan, cash flow

Title: Associations speak up, Naturgas strikes back, Eye on Ecopetrol – Inner Circle Weekly Newsletter for February 22, 2015

Title: Ecopetrol looks to hold production levels

Title: A twisted path for LatAm NOC’s

Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) has been rocked by corruption scandals and Pemex’s ability to function in a privatized market is questionable as the oil price slide cuts into its budget. Let us not even mention PDVSA.
