Headline: The Senate’s fifth commission held a debate on oil production, energy self-sufficiency and general oil policy, bringing in officials led by the Minister of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) Tomás González and Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) president Javier Gutiérrez.

Title: Ecopetrol unveils new water treatment plant in Meta

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has inaugurated a new water treatment facilities in Acacías, Meta, which the NOC says will allow it to quickly increase production in the Castilla field by an additional 30,000bd.

Title: New plants in 2015, 2016, regulations, set to grow biofuel use
Headline: With two new large biofuels refining plants planned for 2015 and 2016 and regulations that will increase the ethanol mixture in gasoline to 13.6% next year, the consumption of biofuels could grow by more than 50% in two years, says the president of the National Fuels Federation (Fedecombustibles) Jorge Bendeck.
Article: With two new large biofuels refining plants planned for 2015 and 2016 and regulations that will increase the ethanol mixture in gasoline to 13.6% next year, the consumption of biofuels could grow by more than 50% in two years, says the president of the National Fuels Federation (Fedecombustibles) Jorge Bendeck.

Title: Reacting to lower prices, according to Acosta

Article: The former Ministry of Mines and Energy, Amylkar Acosta, says considering the decrease in oil prices Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and the industry must lower costs and guarantee a functioning pipeline system in this new scenario.

Title: Ecopetrol not likely to meet production targets

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) had set a production target of 819,000boed for 2014, but with its average after three quarters sitting at 754,800boed, the NOC will almost certainly fall short of its goal.

Title: Roads Review: Casanare association, Huila incidents down, repairs

Article: In Casanare transportation companies have formed a group of committees to better organize the industry, in Huila accidents and congestion due to tankers have declined while road and bridge repairs took place in Casanare, Boyacá and Norte de Santander.

Title: USO member released, absolved, after year in jail

Article: USO Meta vice president Dario Cárdenas has been absolved of charges against him and released from prison a year and three days after being arrested for crimes associated with protests in Puerto Gaitán, Meta.

Title: The future of the Rubiales field remains undefined
Headline: Another quarter passes, and still no decision from Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) on the future of the Rubiales field. Meanwhile political pressure from an alliance led by the oil workers union (USO) and Senator Jorge Robledo mounts to return the field to Ecopetrol control.

Title: PRE production, financial figures drop in Q3
Headline: Production for Colombia’s largest private oil operator Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) dropped in the third quarter of 2014 compared to the previous quarter, as water disposal issues continue to affect its flagship Rubiales field. Management looked to focus on the opportunities for other fields and expectations for Mexico, while ensuring that it would stay in Rubiales and that production would grow.
Article: Production for Colombia’s largest private oil operator Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) dropped in the third quarter of 2014 compared to the previous quarter, as water disposal issues continue to affect its flagship Rubiales field. Management looked to focus on the opportunities for other fields and expectations for Mexico, while ensuring that it would stay in Rubiales and that production would grow.

Title: Fuel prices drop in November

Title: Ecopetrol clarifies Sismopetrol contract, will pay workers

While the firm will keep its projections for 2014 and 2015 for now, company president Javier Gutiérrez said a review of its strategy will be made towards the end of the year.

Title: MinHacienda pushes ECP for more production as profits, production fall

Article: Ecopetrol has released its earnings report for the third quarter 2014, which showed a drop in profits for the quarter both sequentially (17.3%) and year-over-year (40.3%). Title: Colombia’s production model is getting stale says expert
Headline: Colombia’s model for managing the hydrocarbons industry might have brought positive results over the last 10 years, but it is losing force in today’s scenario, with the sector losing its competitive edge due to license delays, security problems and social conflicts, says the director of the Interamerican Development Bank (IDB) oil & gas strategic studies program, Ramón Espinasa.
Article: Colombia’s model for managing the hydrocarbons industry might have brought positive results over the last 10 years, but it is losing force in today’s scenario, with the sector losing its competitive edge due to license delays, security problems and social conflicts, says the director of the Interamerican Development Bank (IDB) oil & gas strategic studies program, Ramón Espinasa.

Title: MinMinas lowers fuel prices in May as debate continues
Headline: Fuel prices dropped in May as the Ministry of Mines and Energy adjusts its formula to set them, while the issue continues to gain traction on different fronts.
Article: Fuel prices dropped in May as the Ministry of Mines and Energy adjusts its formula to set them, while the issue continues to gain traction on different fronts.

Title: Environmental Round-up: All about the water
Headline: Accusations that oil production is destroying local water resources continued to make their way, while a number of oil industry institutions have embarked on campaigns to counter the idea, which is being used to advance the agenda of those opposed to oil. These and other environmental stories from local media.
Article: Accusations that oil production is destroying local water resources continued to make their way, while a number of oil industry institutions have embarked on campaigns to counter the idea, which is being used to advance the agenda of those opposed to oil. Title: Congress debates new changes to the royalty system
Headline: In a joint session of economic commissions from both Colombia’s Senate and House, the Finance Minister Mauricio Cárdenas presented four new changes to the General Royalty System that look to give it access to other sources of funds in case royalties from mining and energy production taper off.
Article: In a joint session of economic commissions from both Colombia’s Senate and House, the Finance Minister Mauricio Cárdenas presented four new changes to the General Royalty System that look to give it access to other sources of funds in case royalties from mining and energy production taper off.

Title: PRE workers union criticizes anti-oil protests
Headline: The president of the National Hydrocarbons Energy Industry Workers Union (Uten) Alejandro Ospina rejected reports that affiliated workers had joined a protest of Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) in Bogotá and said there is an effort to stigmatize the industry.
Article: The president of the National Hydrocarbons Energy Industry Workers Union (Uten) Alejandro Ospina rejected reports that affiliated workers had joined a protest of Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) in Bogotá and said there is an effort to stigmatize the industry.

Title: Parex sees production grow to new record, acquires Verano Energy to focus on Llanos
Headline: Parex Resources (TSX:PXT) says its production has grown to a historic level during the 1Q14 and announced the acquisition of Verano Energy, part of a plan to consolidate its operations in the Southern Llanos basin.
Article: Parex Resources (TSX:PXT) says its production has grown to a historic level during the 1Q14 and announced the acquisition of Verano Energy, part of a plan to consolidate its operations in the Southern Llanos basin.

Title: Changes brewing to improve, expand pipeline infrastructure
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy sent its two highest ranking officials to discuss transportation infrastructure at a recent conference held by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) transportation spin off Cenit. They announced a new regulatory structure and looked to reaffirm MinMinas commitments to large, strategic infrastructure projects.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy sent its two highest ranking officials to discuss transportation infrastructure at a recent conference held by Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) transportation spin off Cenit. They announced a new regulatory structure and looked to reaffirm MinMinas commitments to large, strategic infrastructure projects.

Title: ECP’s Gutiérrez visits Huila to showcase NOC impact
Headline: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) president Javier Gutiérrez attended an event in Neiva, Huila to showcase the advances that the NOC has made in the southern region of the country, highlighting production and the return for the local community.
Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) president Javier Gutiérrez attended an event in Neiva, Huila to showcase the advances that the NOC has made in the southern region of the country, highlighting production and the return for the local community.

Title: USO says its negotiation team ready to start collective bargaining agreement with Ecopetrol
Headline: The USO says it has formed its team that will negotiate a new set of terms and collective bargaining agreement with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), and has already started training with the bargaining team.
Article: The USO says it has formed its team that will negotiate a new set of terms and collective bargaining agreement with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC), and has already started training with the bargaining team.

Title: Barrancabermeja Refinery makes political rounds
Headline: Colombia’ lower house held a debate on the progress of the Barrancabermeja Refinery, which the local mayor says is close to getting an official start after prolonged delays. The matter will be brought up in an Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) board meeting in June.
Article: Colombia’ lower house held a debate on the progress of the Barrancabermeja Refinery, which the local mayor says is close to getting an official start after prolonged delays. The matter will be brought up in an Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) board meeting in June.

Title: Rubiales production falls, but PRE keeps total numbers up
Headline: Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) reported its results from the first quarter 2014, and even though its flagship Rubiales field felt a drop in production, it managed to keep its total production figures on the rise, a sign the firm’s leadership says demonstrates a more diverse production base.
Article: Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) reported its results from the first quarter 2014, and even though its flagship Rubiales field felt a drop in production, it managed to keep its total production figures on the rise, a sign the firm’s leadership says demonstrates a more diverse production base.

Title: Arauca, Norte de Santander, Putumayo feeling brunt of infrastructure attacks
Headline: The departments of Arauca, Norte de Santander and Putumayo have felt the brunt of guerrilla attacks in 2014. As of April 28th, there have been 39 attacks on those departments, while Casanare and Meta face the greatest effect of social conflicts.
Article: The departments of Arauca, Norte de Santander and Putumayo have felt the brunt of guerrilla attacks in 2014. As of April 28th, there have been 39 attacks on those departments, while Casanare and Meta face the greatest effect of social conflicts.

Title: Roads Review: Ecopetrol contracting round, tanker routes, Huila-Putumayo meeting
Headline: Ecopetrol has started this year’s process to hire ground transportation, in Meta the governor says a special route will be designated for tankers and Huila-Putumayo leaders met to discuss transportation issues. Meanwhile a number of accidents and spills caused delays in Casanare and made headlines.
Article: Ecopetrol has started this year’s process to hire ground transportation, in Meta the governor says a special route will be designated for tankers and Huila-Putumayo leaders met to discuss transportation issues. Meanwhile a number of accidents and spills caused delays in Casanare and made headlines.

Title: Satellite technology for exploration generating more interest
Headline: The use of oil, gas and minerals finder technology (OFT) which harnesses satellite imagery to identify mineral content has been in Colombia for around three years, but technology suppliers say that it is only recently gaining interest for exploration.
Article: The use of oil, gas and minerals finder technology (OFT) which harnesses satellite imagery to identify mineral content has been in Colombia for around three years, but technology suppliers say that it is only recently gaining interest for exploration.

Title: As production goals slip, so increase concerns about sustainability
Headline: In order for Colombia to achieve self- sufficiency for its own oil supply, an important and dramatic discovery of reserves must happen this decade, otherwise keeping along current trends the reserves logged would not supply the country past 2018, according to a government report.
Article: In order for Colombia to achieve self- sufficiency for its own oil supply, an important and dramatic discovery of reserves must happen this decade, otherwise keeping along current trends the reserves logged would not supply the country past 2018, according to a government report.

Title: ECP expects Caño Limon running this week
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) officials said during its first quarter 2014 conference call that crews working on the Caño Lion-Coveñas pipeline should have it running five days after starting work, and gave estimates as how many barrels of crude it loses everyday due to attacks.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) officials said during its first quarter 2014 conference call that crews working on the Caño Lion-Coveñas pipeline should have it running five days after starting work, and gave estimates as how many barrels of crude it loses everyday due to attacks.

Title: USO pressures Ecopetrol on Barrancabermeja Refinery
Headline: Members of the USO national chapter held a meeting with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to discuss the modernization of the Barrancabermeja Refinery, and called for work to start immediately.
Article: Members of the USO national chapter held a meeting with Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) to discuss the modernization of the Barrancabermeja Refinery, and called for work to start immediately.

Title: Just when you think it is over…
Headline: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were down to 33, below recent but above long-term averages. Non-Armed-Forces-reported incidents were just about average in percentage terms and in absolute terms. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down correspondingly at 34.0 and the 52 week average was stable at 31.3 incidents per week.
Article: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were down to 33, below recent but above long-term averages. Non-Armed-Forces-reported incidents were just about average in percentage terms and in absolute terms. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down correspondingly at 34.0 and the 52 week average was stable at 31.3 incidents per week.

Title: U’WA, Government reach agreement to let pipeline repairs start
Headline: The national government and the U’WA indigenous community have reached an agreement that will allow repair crews to access the damaged Caño Limon – Coveñas pipeline, which has been out of service since a bombing on March 25th.
Article: The national government and the U’WA indigenous community have reached an agreement that will allow repair crews to access the damaged Caño Limon – Coveñas pipeline, which has been out of service since a bombing on March 25th.

Title: Inner Circle Monthly Report for May 2014
Headline: This month we start with an interview with Independence’s Rose Marie Saab. She gives an optimistic view of the industry but a realistic one, based both on her role as the leader of Independence – a leading oil services company –but also as the chairperson of the board of Campetrol, the services industry association.
Article: This month we start with an interview with Independence’s Rose Marie Saab. She gives an optimistic view of the industry but a realistic one, based both on her role as the leader of Independence – a leading oil services company –but also as the chairperson of the board of Campetrol, the services industry association.

Title: ODL Pipeline planning new extension
Headline: The ODL pipeline is planning a new pipeline extension that will run from Carmentea – Araguaney and together with the Yopal municipal council, Casanare Departmental Assembly and the municipal Advising Office of Planning will hold a series of community meetings to socialize the project.
Article: The ODL pipeline is planning a new pipeline extension that will run from Carmentea – Araguaney and together with the Yopal municipal council, Casanare Departmental Assembly and the municipal Advising Office of Planning will hold a series of community meetings to socialize the project.

Title: Operational issues, price drop cut into Ecopetrol 1Q14 results
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) confirmed that the operational reality on the ground is cutting into its production abilities, which has coupled with increased costs and lower oil prices for a rough first quarter 2014 for the NOC.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) confirmed that the operational reality on the ground is cutting into its production abilities, which has coupled with increased costs and lower oil prices for a rough first quarter 2014 for the NOC.

Title: PRE receives World Bank financing for LNG plant
Headline: GasPacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) will receive US$75M from the International Finance Corporation, part of the World Bank, for a liquid natural gas LNG plant that it is building to export gas produced by the company from the La Creciente field.
Article: GasPacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) will receive US$75M from the International Finance Corporation, part of the World Bank, for a liquid natural gas LNG plant that it is building to export gas produced by the company from the La Creciente field.

Title: MinMinas defends company water use, addresses seismic activity
Headline: During the debate on the Casanare drought in Colombia’s Senate, the Minister of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) Amylkar Acosta addressed accusations that oil production is depleting water resources in Casanare and addressed the increased seismic activity in Puerto Gaitán, Meta, saying that scientific research must confirm the causes.
Article: During the debate on the Casanare drought in Colombia’s Senate, the Minister of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) Amylkar Acosta addressed accusations that oil production is depleting water resources in Casanare and addressed the increased seismic activity in Puerto Gaitán, Meta, saying that scientific research must confirm the causes.

Title: What to do about cheaper gasoline?
Headline: The government has received substantial political pressure to lower fuel prices, but Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it will continue to produce fuels despite a price that cuts into their margins and in turn, their ability to invest.
Article: The government has received substantial political pressure to lower fuel prices, but Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) says it will continue to produce fuels despite a price that cuts into their margins and in turn, their ability to invest.

Title: Casanare has released the genie of environmental debate

Article: The drought in Casanare continues to draw headlines even if rains have reached the region. Relating oil production to the problem has become a convenient fact for the anti-oil lobby.

Title: USO says STAR problems warrant the non-renewal of PRE contract
Headline: The USO reacted to news that Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) and Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) met to discuss the STAR secondary recovery project accusing PRE of poor management of the project and called for the NOC to not renew the production contract with the Canadian firm.
Article: The USO reacted to news that Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) and Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) met to discuss the STAR secondary recovery project accusing PRE of poor management of the project and called for the NOC to not renew the production contract with the Canadian firm.

Title: U’WA, government meet but no advances

Article: Members of the U´WA indigenous community finally met on April 25th to discuss an agreement that would allow repair crews in to fix the damaged Caño Limon – Coveñas pipeline but no agreement was reached.

Title: Ecopetrol wins injunction to block Monterrey referendum
Headline: As we have reported previously, the mayor of Monterrey, Casanare had the population whipped up to vote in an anti-oil referendum this coming Sunday. Now Ecopetrol has succeeded in having the vote blocked while judges consider the constitutionality of such a referendum.
Article: As we have reported previously, the mayor of Monterrey, Casanare had the population whipped up to vote in an anti-oil referendum this coming Sunday. Now Ecopetrol has succeeded in having the vote blocked while judges consider the constitutionality of such a referendum.

Title: U’WA skips out on government meeting, progress on hold
Headline: The U’WA indigenous group, who has been blocking access of repair crews to damaged sections of the Caño Limón – Coveñas pipeline, skipped a meeting scheduled for April 18th with the national government and say they will only meet for a previously established roundtable on the 25th. Meanwhile, the pipeline remains out of service.
Article: The U’WA indigenous group, who has been blocking access of repair crews to damaged sections of the Caño Limón – Coveñas pipeline, skipped a meeting scheduled for April 18th with the national government and say they will only meet for a previously established roundtable on the 25th. Title: Pacific Rubiales having a bad week and its only Wednesday
Headline: Unusual seismic readings in the company’s most important territory of Puerto Gaitan, Meta and a 1Q14 operations update saying that the company’s largest field, Rubiales, will have lower production again this quarter seem to have spooked investors.
Article: Unusual seismic readings in the company’s most important territory of Puerto Gaitan, Meta and a 1Q14 operations update saying that the company’s largest field, Rubiales, will have lower production again this quarter seem to have spooked investors.

Title: Monterrey pushes ahead with referendum despite warnings
Headline: The Monterrey municipal council says it will go ahead with a public referendum to accept or reject oil exploration and production near the municipal water resources despite warnings and court rulings that this task is reserved for the national government.
Article: The Monterrey municipal council says it will go ahead with a public referendum to accept or reject oil exploration and production near the municipal water resources despite warnings and court rulings that this task is reserved for the national government.

Title: Proposals for alternative hydrocarbons transportation
Headline: Proposals for reorganizing how hydrocarbons are transported, everything from an integration of large trucking firms to optimize use, to trains and to harnessing the Magdalena River have all been proposed over the last week.
Article: Proposals for reorganizing how hydrocarbons are transported, everything from an integration of large trucking firms to optimize use, to trains and to harnessing the Magdalena River have all been proposed over the last week.

Title: Putumayo residents reject Ecopetrol explanations on river contamination

Title: Caño Limon-Coveñas attack toll keeps on adding up

Article: The damage and aftermath of guerrilla attacks on this sensitive set of pipelines keeps on snowballing, with reports estimating that the lost barrels have long surpassed a million and that a good portion of the Caño Limon field is at a halt.

Headline: The national government says that it will visit the U´WA indigenous group that is blocking the access of repair crews to the Caño Limon-Coveñas pipeline, which has been inoperable following a guerrilla attack on March 24th.
Article: The national government says that it will visit the U´WA indigenous group that is blocking the access of repair crews to the Caño Limon-Coveñas pipeline, which has been inoperable following a guerrilla attack on March 24th.

Article: Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) president Jose Francisco Arata published an opinion piece in the magazine of a national paper and talked about what would contribute to a stable, developed economy and industry in 2074.

Title: Ecopetrol forms “Supplier’s University”

Article: In order to offer current and potential suppliers an updated panorama into different aspects of the oil industry Ecopetrol has agreed with The University of Bogotá Jorge Tadeo Lozano to create a “Supplier’s University”, and will subsidize the cost during the first stage of the project.

Title: Ecopetrol, Chevron to build bi-directional gas plant

Article: GasEcopetrol (NYSE:EC) will build a bi-directional gas plant together with Chevron (NYSE:CVX) in order to both store natural gas in case of shortages and also export to other markets.

Title: Three years after US-Colombia FTA signing, USO says government suppressing unions
Headline: The USO did not let the three year signing of the free trade agreement between the United States and Colombia pass without pointing out what the union considers a concerted effort from the central government to suppress union rights, one of the contentious points of the agreement in the US congress.
Article: The USO did not let the three year signing of the free trade agreement between the United States and Colombia pass without pointing out what the union considers a concerted effort from the central government to suppress union rights, one of the contentious points of the agreement in the US congress.

Title: Predicting March production from political delay
Headline: Faithful readers will know we always try to have a graph. We saved today’s slot for March production but it has not been published yet. So we decided to have some fun. After all, it is Friday and we are frequently criticized for being way too serious.
Article: Faithful readers will know we always try to have a graph. We saved today’s slot for March production but it has not been published yet. So we decided to have some fun. After all, it is Friday and we are frequently criticized for being way too serious.

Title: A perfect storm of problems at Caño Limon
Headline: The final stretch of the Colombia’s great oil infrastructure: The Bicentennial Pipeline passes through Caño Limon, which is fraught with problems. Guerrillas attack it, while an indigenous community will not let crews in to repair it. The end result is missed shipments, 35,000bd of lost production worth millions a day and jobs for the local community. Who will right this situation?
Article: The final stretch of the Colombia’s great oil infrastructure: The Bicentennial Pipeline passes through Caño Limon, which is fraught with problems. Guerrillas attack it, while an indigenous community will not let crews in to repair it. The end result is missed shipments, 35,000bd of lost production worth millions a day and jobs for the local community. Who will right this situation?

Title: Roads Review: Criticizing Bogotá
Headline: A meeting in Yopal that included all the big institutions from the national government for a roads project in Casanare yielded an offer of support from the national government, but the local authorities say it pales in comparison to the costs of keeping heavy trucks on the road.
Article: A meeting in Yopal that included all the big institutions from the national government for a roads project in Casanare yielded an offer of support from the national government, but the local authorities say it pales in comparison to the costs of keeping heavy trucks on the road.

Title: Oxy cuts 500 workers as pipeline suffers repeat attacks, ECP also affected
Headline: Frequent attacks on the Caño Limon and Bicentennial Pipeline have claimed another causality: 500 jobs with Occidental de Colombia (Oxy), who has cut the positions as their pumping station in Arauca has been unable to keep up optimum crude levels for a month due to attacks from the ELN guerrilla, while another report says partner Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has declared force majeure on shipments for the same reason.
Article: Frequent attacks on the Caño Limon and Bicentennial Pipeline have claimed another causality: 500 jobs with Occidental de Colombia (Oxy), who has cut the positions as their pumping station in Arauca has been unable to keep up optimum crude levels for a month due to attacks from the ELN guerrilla, while another report says partner Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has declared force majeure on shipments for the same reason.

Title: Cenit celebrates its first year
Headline: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) transport and logistics spinoff Cenit has celebrated its first year of operations, and hailed the completion of the Bicentennial Pipeline as the highlight for this first year.
Article: Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) transport and logistics spinoff Cenit has celebrated its first year of operations, and hailed the completion of the Bicentennial Pipeline as the highlight for this first year.

Title: MinAmbiente says seismic restrictions coming
Headline: The Minister of Environment and Sustainable Development (MinAmbiente) Luz Helena Sarmiento is planning to present a legislative bill and new decree to “align environmental legislation to the needs required for climate control prevention”, which will likely include restrictions on seismic exploration.
Article: The Minister of Environment and Sustainable Development (MinAmbiente) Luz Helena Sarmiento is planning to present a legislative bill and new decree to “align environmental legislation to the needs required for climate control prevention”, which will likely include restrictions on seismic exploration.

Title: USO decries ECP firing of Cartegena chapter president
Headline: The USO says the recent firing of the president of its Cartagena chapter –the arm of the union wrapped up in an extended conflict at the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar)- constitutes a new strategy “to exterminate” the union.
Article: The USO says the recent firing of the president of its Cartagena chapter –the arm of the union wrapped up in an extended conflict at the Cartagena Refinery (Reficar)- constitutes a new strategy “to exterminate” the union.

Title: Guerrilla catch their breath
Headline: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were up to 40, above recent and long-term averages. Non-Armed-Forces-reported incidents were below average both in percentage and absolute terms. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down at 39.7 and the 52 week average was up slightly at 31.2 incidents per week.
Article: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were up to 40, above recent and long-term averages. Non-Armed-Forces-reported incidents were below average both in percentage and absolute terms. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down at 39.7 and the 52 week average was up slightly at 31.2 incidents per week.

Title: Cabrales looks to US policy book, talks unconventional resources
Headline: Colombia’s vice-minister of energy Orlando Cabrales says that unconventional resources are a critical element for the country’s energy future and following in line with US policy, touts energy security as the long term goal.
Article: Colombia’s vice-minister of energy Orlando Cabrales says that unconventional resources are a critical element for the country’s energy future and following in line with US policy, touts energy security as the long term goal.

Title: Benchmarking royalty rates 4Q13
Headline: Excluding the ‘Additional Participation’ aka ‘Factor X’, average royalty rates in Colombia declined from 16.3% in 4Q12 to 15.5% in 4Q13, reflecting the slow shift in production from Traditional contracts to production from E&P Contracts, and from mature fields to newer fields with lower rates. But the graph shows there is considerable variation around the average.
Article: Excluding the ‘Additional Participation’ aka ‘Factor X’, average royalty rates in Colombia declined from 16.3% in 4Q12 to 15.5% in 4Q13, reflecting the slow shift in production from Traditional contracts to production from E&P Contracts, and from mature fields to newer fields with lower rates. But the graph shows there is considerable variation around the average.

Title: ECP, Infrastructure Chamber form Alliance around infrastructure investments
Headline: With an eye on the nearly US$10.6B that Ecopetrol has to invest over 2014 in different aspects of its business, the Colombian Chamber of Infrastructure (CCI) has formed an alliance with the NOC to ensure the hydrocarbons investment plan brings benefits for the sector and oil producer alike.
Article: With an eye on the nearly US$10.6B that Ecopetrol has to invest over 2014 in different aspects of its business, the Colombian Chamber of Infrastructure (CCI) has formed an alliance with the NOC to ensure the hydrocarbons investment plan brings benefits for the sector and oil producer alike.

Title: Implicit transport costs weigh down average realized oil prices
Headline: The gap between WTI and Brent opened in late 2010 and from mid-2011 to mid-2013 average Colombian realized oil prices moved in the gap. The gap has closed somewhat in the past few quarters but, for unrelated reasons, average Colombian realized oil prices have moved to or below WTI.
Article: The gap between WTI and Brent opened in late 2010 and from mid-2011 to mid-2013 average Colombian realized oil prices moved in the gap. The gap has closed somewhat in the past few quarters but, for unrelated reasons, average Colombian realized oil prices have moved to or below WTI.

Article: Peru’s NOC Petroperú has announced it will float 49% of its shares to public markets, opening the state run firm to private capital. What lessons are in this for Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC)?

Title: USO says detained members lives are endangered
Headline: The USO is back at full stride this week and leading last week’s list of statements were accusations that two of the four members detained recently for public order problems are facing a complex situation inside jail and lives are at risk, and repeated accusations that the government is targeting union members at the bidding of multinationals such as Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE).
Article: The USO is back at full stride this week and leading last week’s list of statements were accusations that two of the four members detained recently for public order problems are facing a complex situation inside jail and lives are at risk, and repeated accusations that the government is targeting union members at the bidding of multinationals such as Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE).

Title: Truce over and incidents rise
Headline: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were up significantly this week at 47, the highest level since early March. Non-Armed Forces-reported incidents were above average in absolute terms but below average as a percentage of the total. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was up at 28.8 and the 52 week average was actually down slightly but essentially unchanged at 32.6 incidents per week.
Article: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were up significantly this week at 47, the highest level since early March. Non-Armed Forces-reported incidents were above average in absolute terms but below average as a percentage of the total. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was up at 28.8 and the 52 week average was actually down slightly but essentially unchanged at 32.6 incidents per week.

Title: Water supplies could be threatened by seismic activity, says executive
Headline: The general manager of EAAV, the sewage and aqueduct company of Villavicencio Hector Castro says that seismic exploration near the aqueduct’s intake has the potential to collapse the infrastructure.
Article: The general manager of EAAV, the sewage and aqueduct company of Villavicencio Hector Castro says that seismic exploration near the aqueduct’s intake has the potential to collapse the infrastructure.

Title: Notable increase in tanker-truck accidents reported in Huila
Headline: In the Huila Department local highway police figures have found a sharp increase in the number of accidents involving tanker-trucks. In 2012 there were only three such accidents reported, while in 2013 that number spiked to 19, more than six times greater.
Article: In the Huila Department local highway police figures have found a sharp increase in the number of accidents involving tanker-trucks. In 2012 there were only three such accidents reported, while in 2013 that number spiked to 19, more than six times greater.

Title: PetroTiger feels victimized as well
Headline: We were offered an opportunity to interview PetroTiger board chairman, Mauricio Camargo who wanted to give the company’s position on the case of former executives accused in the US of bribing a now ex-Ecopetrol employee.
Article: We were offered an opportunity to interview PetroTiger board chairman, Mauricio Camargo who wanted to give the company’s position on the case of former executives accused in the US of bribing a now ex-Ecopetrol employee.

Title: New USO president lays out agenda
Headline: Following elections last November, the USO has a new president, Edwin Castaño Monsalve, who replaced Rodolfo Vecinos as the head of the union’s national leadership. Castaño looks to expand the USO’s reach towards sub-contracted workers and like his predecessor, has his sights set on Pacific Rubiales (TXS:PRE).
Article: Following elections last November, the USO has a new president, Edwin Castaño Monsalve, who replaced Rodolfo Vecinos as the head of the union’s national leadership. Castaño looks to expand the USO’s reach towards sub-contracted workers and like his predecessor, has his sights set on Pacific Rubiales (TXS:PRE).

Title: MinMinas addresses PetroTiger case
Headline: A corruption scandal involving a pair of US former PetroTiger executives who paid an now ex-Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) engineer more than US$300,000 to win a nearly US$50M contract has rattled Colombia’s oil industry, and the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) issued a thorough release in which it establishes the engineer was working as a rogue and that the NOC is another victim.
Article: A corruption scandal involving a pair of US former PetroTiger executives who paid an now ex-Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) engineer more than US$300,000 to win a nearly US$50M contract has rattled Colombia’s oil industry, and the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) issued a thorough release in which it establishes the engineer was working as a rogue and that the NOC is another victim.

Title: Talisman planning US$300M in investments in 2014
Headline: Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) is planning to invest US$300M in its operations in Colombia, with an eye on developing identified reserves in the Llanos Orientales CPO-9 and CPE-6 blocks.
Article: Talisman Energy (NYSE:TLM) is planning to invest US$300M in its operations in Colombia, with an eye on developing identified reserves in the Llanos Orientales CPO-9 and CPE-6 blocks.

Title: USO kicks off the year calling for the release of its members
Headline: The USO has launched into a sustained campaign calling for the release of several members detained for alleged public order crimes during the end of 2013. The union will hold a rally at the headquarters of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and accuses the oil sector, led by Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE), of targeting its organization.
Article: The USO has launched into a sustained campaign calling for the release of several members detained for alleged public order crimes during the end of 2013. The union will hold a rally at the headquarters of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and accuses the oil sector, led by Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE), of targeting its organization.

Title: PRE looks to convince in 2014 outlook
Headline: Canada’s Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) looked to convince the market that it has a bright future past the looming decline of its flagship and namesake field, Rubiales, and has a plan to cash in on its mid-stream assets to convince a skeptical equity market.
Article: Canada’s Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) looked to convince the market that it has a bright future past the looming decline of its flagship and namesake field, Rubiales, and has a plan to cash in on its mid-stream assets to convince a skeptical equity market.

Title: Glass half full or glass half empty: Crude oil production 2013
Headline: MinMinas released December crude oil production and natural gas consumption figures which allowed the quarterly and annual results to be calculated.
Article: MinMinas released December crude oil production and natural gas consumption figures which allowed the quarterly and annual results to be calculated.

Title: Pacific Rubiales takes a leap
Headline: If Ecopetrol (NYSE: EC) brought CAPEX back home, Pacific Rubiales (TSX: PRE) did the opposite, raising exploration investment outside Colombia by 67%.
Article: If Ecopetrol (NYSE: EC) brought CAPEX back home, Pacific Rubiales (TSX: PRE) did the opposite, raising exploration investment outside Colombia by 67%.

Title: Accusations of under-reporting again in Casanare
Headline: A Casanare land owner is accusing Lewis Energy Colombia of working outside the bounds of its environmental license, which she says has affected a local river and flooded her land, and that the company has also been under reporting its production, while one report suggests the dispute is about compensation for production rights on her land.
Article: A Casanare land owner is accusing Lewis Energy Colombia of working outside the bounds of its environmental license, which she says has affected a local river and flooded her land, and that the company has also been under reporting its production, while one report suggests the dispute is about compensation for production rights on her land.

Title: Ecopetrol renews truck contracting process
Headline: Following a blockade that limited access to the Rubiales field by local truckers that want a larger role in the transport of crude, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has announced a new contractor selection process designed to open opportunities for local suppliers.
Article: Following a blockade that limited access to the Rubiales field by local truckers that want a larger role in the transport of crude, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has announced a new contractor selection process designed to open opportunities for local suppliers.

Title: Ecopetrol brings it back home
Headline: Ecopetrol’s board recently approved the company’s CAPEX budget as we reported yesterday in an article that focused on the Refining and Petrochemical business. Today we step back to look at the panorama.
Article: Ecopetrol’s board recently approved the company’s CAPEX budget as we reported yesterday in an article that focused on the Refining and Petrochemical business. Today we step back to look at the panorama.

Title: Production growth to slow in 2014
Headline: The Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) says growth next year will only be 2.3% which means a projection of 1.03mmbd versus the expected result for this year of 1.006mmbd. The graph shows this means fairly flat growth.
Article: The Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP) says growth next year will only be 2.3% which means a projection of 1.03mmbd versus the expected result for this year of 1.006mmbd. The graph shows this means fairly flat growth.

Title: MinMinas says Tauramena impact overstated
Headline: Looking to brush off concerns that the recent vote against oil production in the Tauramena Municipality, The Minister of Mines and Energy (MinMinas), Amylkar Acosta said that the government has been meeting with local authorities and there are already laws on the book that adequately address the protection of water resources.
Article: Looking to brush off concerns that the recent vote against oil production in the Tauramena Municipality, The Minister of Mines and Energy (MinMinas), Amylkar Acosta said that the government has been meeting with local authorities and there are already laws on the book that adequately address the protection of water resources.

Title: Ecopetrol unveils US$10.6B Capex plan for 2014
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) announced its Capex plan for 2014, with the NOC focusing nearly all of its US$10.6B within Colombia and its wholly owned projects as the firm looks to keep production levels in line with government goals in an election year.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) announced its Capex plan for 2014, with the NOC focusing nearly all of its US$10.6B within Colombia and its wholly owned projects as the firm looks to keep production levels in line with government goals in an election year.

Title: USO says Petro destitution an attack on democracy
Headline: The USO sounded off against last week’s destitution of Bogotá mayor Gustavo Petro, calling it a “crooked persecution against the union and social movements and political left in general in favor of the neoliberal model and extreme right”, and said the situation is comparable to arrests of members on December 4.
Article: The USO sounded off against last week’s destitution of Bogotá mayor Gustavo Petro, calling it a “crooked persecution against the union and social movements and political left in general in favor of the neoliberal model and extreme right”, and said the situation is comparable to arrests of members on December 4.

Title: Tauramena votes against oil production in public referendum
Headline: The Municipality of Tauramena, Casanare held its public referendum on Sunday, December 15th and those who came out voted a sounding no, although the total turnout amounted to just over 34% of the population, narrowly passing the 33% turnout needed for the vote to be valid.
Article: The Municipality of Tauramena, Casanare held its public referendum on Sunday, December 15th and those who came out voted a sounding no, although the total turnout amounted to just over 34% of the population, narrowly passing the 33% turnout needed for the vote to be valid.

Title: After a prolonged silence, government puts Tauramena referendum on the agenda
Headline: The government engaged a multi-pronged push back against a public referendum that looks to reject oil production near municipal water sources in Tauramena, Casanare which included ministers and Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) president Javier Gutiérrez.
Article: The government engaged a multi-pronged push back against a public referendum that looks to reject oil production near municipal water sources in Tauramena, Casanare which included ministers and Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) president Javier Gutiérrez.

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and Talisman announce commercial viability in CPO-09 block, which will add 35 million barrels of reserves and marks the second addition by the NOC in as many weeks.

Title: New USO leadership decries multiple arrests
Headline: The USO announced the results of their election at the end of November, and the new president Edwin Castaño Monsalve´s first task was to lead an alert that three members of the union have been detained in what the organization calls a judicial set up for actions against Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE).
Article: The USO announced the results of their election at the end of November, and the new president Edwin Castaño Monsalve´s first task was to lead an alert that three members of the union have been detained in what the organization calls a judicial set up for actions against Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE).

Title: PRE completes Chivor-Rubiales electrical transmission line
Headline: Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) says it has finished and launched an electrical transmission line that runs from the hydro-electrical center in Chivor, Boyacá to its flagship field Rubiales in Meta, which it says will save US$100M in operational costs annually.
Article: Pacific Rubiales Energy (TSX:PRE) says it has finished and launched an electrical transmission line that runs from the hydro-electrical center in Chivor, Boyacá to its flagship field Rubiales in Meta, which it says will save US$100M in operational costs annually.

Title: As oil referendum approaches, efforts to highlight or deter oil production in Tauramena
Headline: A public referendum to accept or reject oil production near water resources around the Tauramena is just days away, while Petrominerales (TSX:PMG) holds a meeting to establish ties to local businesses for hiring goods and services and politicians clamor on the threat of seismic testing.
Article: A public referendum to accept or reject oil production near water resources around the Tauramena is just days away, while Petrominerales (TSX:PMG) holds a meeting to establish ties to local businesses for hiring goods and services and politicians clamor on the threat of seismic testing.

Title: Ecopetrol declares commercial viability of Eastern Caño Sur block, adds 22.4M barrels of reserves
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has declared to Colombia’s National Hydrocarbons Agency the commercial viability of the Eastern Caño Sur block, adding 22.4 million barrels of 1P reserves.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) has declared to Colombia’s National Hydrocarbons Agency the commercial viability of the Eastern Caño Sur block, adding 22.4 million barrels of 1P reserves.

Title: MinMinas says fuel prices down yoy, outlines formula concepts
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) published an outline of the policy alignments of the formula to set fuel prices, and said that prices will remain stable in December and have actually shown a 4% decrease compared to last year.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) published an outline of the policy alignments of the formula to set fuel prices, and said that prices will remain stable in December and have actually shown a 4% decrease compared to last year.

Title: MinMinas signs energy cooperation agreement with US government

Article: The Colombian government, by way of the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) signed a memorandum of understanding with the US government in Washington DC to cooperate on energy matters.

Title: Ecopetrol awards top suppliers

Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) awarded a group of 24 suppliers whose performance as contractors stood out as a model in 2013 in a ceremony held in Bogotá.

Title: USO holds elections, accuses CB&I of blocking process
Headline: The USO held elections last week on November 28 and 29th to elect its national representatives. No results have been released thus far, but the union did accuse Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) contractor CB&I (NYSE:CBI) of threatening workers resulting in a low turnout.
Article: The USO held elections last week on November 28 and 29th to elect its national representatives. No results have been released thus far, but the union did accuse Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) contractor CB&I (NYSE:CBI) of threatening workers resulting in a low turnout.

Title: Now in Meta: community signatures to reject oil production
Headline: An environmentalist group (La Mesa Hídríca del Piedemonte) which focuses on water issues in the Meta Department, has gathered and submitted 20,000 signatures rejecting oil production work in the nearby Lorito 1 well, in the Guamal municipality.
Article: An environmentalist group (La Mesa Hídríca del Piedemonte) which focuses on water issues in the Meta Department, has gathered and submitted 20,000 signatures rejecting oil production work in the nearby Lorito 1 well, in the Guamal municipality.

Title: Barrancabermeja Refinery to generate 5,000 new jobs, on track for 2014

Article: Estimates from Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) are that upcoming phases of the current modernization work at the Barrancabermeja Refinery will employ up to 5000 people at its peak of activity in 2014.

Title: Blockades affecting tanker-truck movement in Casanare
Headline: The Colombian Association of Truckers has staged a blockade in Casanare, demanding that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) favor local truckers over regional or foreign providers and pay a standby fee for waits incurred prior to loading.
Article: The Colombian Association of Truckers has staged a blockade in Casanare, demanding that Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) and Pacific Rubiales (TSX:PRE) favor local truckers over regional or foreign providers and pay a standby fee for waits incurred prior to loading.

Title: Casanare launches police unit to support oil industry
Headline: Casanare has become the eighth department to receive a special investigative unit, called the Structure of Support (EDA), which will focus on criminal cases involving the oil industry and its infrastructure.
Article: Casanare has become the eighth department to receive a special investigative unit, called the Structure of Support (EDA), which will focus on criminal cases involving the oil industry and its infrastructure.

Title: Yet another date for the OBC launch: December
Headline: Javier Gutiérrez, president of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) made a visit to the municipality in San Antero and told local press that the Bicentennial Pipeline (OBC) will be online in December, the latest change in the start of its operations, mainly due to security threats.
Article: Javier Gutiérrez, president of Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) made a visit to the municipality in San Antero and told local press that the Bicentennial Pipeline (OBC) will be online in December, the latest change in the start of its operations, mainly due to security threats.

Title: The great debate: extraction versus environment
Headline: Hydrocarbons Colombia organized a debate on environmental management in the hydrocarbons industry between two Colombian heavyweights: environmentalist Juan Pablo Ruiz Soto (the only Colombian to have climbed Mount Everest) and Jose Francisco Arata, president of Colombia’s largest entirely shareholder-owned oil company, Pacific Rubiales.
Article: Hydrocarbons Colombia organized a debate on environmental management in the hydrocarbons industry between two Colombian heavyweights: environmentalist Juan Pablo Ruiz Soto (the only Colombian to have climbed Mount Everest) and Jose Francisco Arata, president of Colombia’s largest entirely shareholder-owned oil company, Pacific Rubiales.

Title: MinMinas says modernized refineries could lower fuel costs
Headline: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) has presented its formula to lower fuel costs at the pump and also believes that the modernization of national refineries could also contribute to a lower price in the midterm.
Article: The Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas) has presented its formula to lower fuel costs at the pump and also believes that the modernization of national refineries could also contribute to a lower price in the midterm.

Title: Truck accident leads to tanker suspension in Huila
Headline: A chain of events set off by a truck loaded with 230 barrels of crude crashing on a Putumayo highway which led then to a spill which reached the Magdalena river, has moved local authorities to ban a number of transport companies from operating and heavy trucks from using their normal routes in Huila.
Article: A chain of events set off by a truck loaded with 230 barrels of crude crashing on a Putumayo highway which led then to a spill which reached the Magdalena river, has moved local authorities to ban a number of transport companies from operating and heavy trucks from using their normal routes in Huila.

Title: Ecopetrol rolling out pilot project in Huila to increase crude recovery in older fields
Headline: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is launching a pilot plant that will implement a chemical recovery technology in its 28-year-old San Francisco field as part of a larger strategy to increase production in mature fields.
Article: Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) is launching a pilot plant that will implement a chemical recovery technology in its 28-year-old San Francisco field as part of a larger strategy to increase production in mature fields.

Title: Problems along Perenco pipeline after rupture leaks into water supply
Headline: A break in UK oil producer Perenco’s pipeline caused 15 barrels of oil to leak into a nearby stream in Casanare, affecting the water supply of the Aguazul and Maní municipalities, and the local environmental management agency has called for the National Environmental Licensing Agency (ANLA) to intervene.
Article: A break in UK oil producer Perenco’s pipeline caused 15 barrels of oil to leak into a nearby stream in Casanare, affecting the water supply of the Aguazul and Maní municipalities, and the local environmental management agency has called for the National Environmental Licensing Agency (ANLA) to intervene.

Article: The National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH) has set its sights on the 2014 Round to award new E&P contracts as a potential boost to investment in the hydrocarbons sector.

Title: Association says exploration activity drying up

Title: Ecopetrol to keep on producing fuel even if prices drop
Headline: The economic model used to determine the price of fuel for the consumer is set to be a central theme for debate as Colombia moves into an election year, but several experts asked by the local press concur that the main refinery producer, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) will continue producing fuel regardless.
Article: The economic model used to determine the price of fuel for the consumer is set to be a central theme for debate as Colombia moves into an election year, but several experts asked by the local press concur that the main refinery producer, Ecopetrol (NYSE:EC) will continue producing fuel regardless.

Title: OTA leak contaminating Ecuadorian river
Headline: Oil from a rupture along the Transandino Pipeline (OTA) on the Colombia-Ecuador border has leaked into the banks of the San Miguel river causing contamination and requiring intervention from Ecuadorian NOC Petroamazonas.
Article: Oil from a rupture along the Transandino Pipeline (OTA) on the Colombia-Ecuador border has leaked into the banks of the San Miguel river causing contamination and requiring intervention from Ecuadorian NOC Petroamazonas.

Title: Another oil referendum brewing in Aguazul
Headline: In December the Tauramena municipality will hold a public referendum to approve or reject nearby oil production in certain, named villages and now in Aguazul municipal leaders are looking to do the same and get the public to vote on Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) Odisea 3D seismic exploration program.
Article: In December the Tauramena municipality will hold a public referendum to approve or reject nearby oil production in certain, named villages and now in Aguazul municipal leaders are looking to do the same and get the public to vote on Ecopetrol’s (NYSE:EC) Odisea 3D seismic exploration program.

Title: Why the Ecopetrol-led roads agreement in Casanare matters

Article: A local activist and former politician has insisted authorities apply measures to limit tanker-truckers on main highways in Villavicencio Meta, demonstrating the context and need for more agreements on roads between the industry, local authorities and the community in general, like the one signed last week in Casanare.

Title: Anti-exploration rhetoric hits the local press

Title: Guerrilla step up the action
Headline: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were back up this week to 38 above recent and long-term averages. Non-Armed Forces incidents were significantly above average at 27%. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Correspondingly, our 4-week Moving Average incident count was up to 35.0 but the 52 week average was down although essentially unchanged at 33.9 incidents per week.
Article: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were back up this week to 38 above recent and long-term averages. Non-Armed Forces incidents were significantly above average at 27%. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Correspondingly, our 4-week Moving Average incident count was up to 35.0 but the 52 week average was down although essentially unchanged at 33.9 incidents per week.

Title: PRE says production to hold in post-Rubiales era

Title: Talisman upbeat on Colombia prospects

Title: National Registry confirms schedule, wording of question in oil vote

Article: The director of the Casanare environmental management agency Corporinoquia inspected the steps taken at a petroleum toxic waste plant to fix handling issues in the municipality of Pore and though it found advances, it will decide based on lab examinations whether or not to lift the preventative measure placed on the facility.

Title: Targeting the energy industry
Headline: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were essentially unchanged at 31 consistent with the recent experience but slightly below the long-term average. However, non-Armed Forces incidents were above average at 19%. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Correspondingly, our 4-week Moving Average incident count was stable at 29.5 but the 52 week average dropped slightly to 34.3 incidents per week.
Article: Incidents near areas of interest to the oil and gas industry were essentially unchanged at 31 consistent with the recent experience but slightly below the long-term average. However, non-Armed Forces incidents were above average at 19%. This is our indicator of increased guerrilla-initiated activity. Correspondingly, our 4-week Moving Average incident count was stable at 29.5 but the 52 week average dropped slightly to 34.3 incidents per week.

Title: Ecopetrol planning seismic exploration in Caquetá

Title: Ecopetrol says a drop of CoP$1000 at the pump means company loss of US$1.75B
Headline: Ecopetrol’s president Javier Gutiérrez says that the NOC’s refining business is already operating at a lost in some cases and a drop in the final price between CoP$1000-2000 would mean losses for the company around US$1.75B.
Article: Ecopetrol’s president Javier Gutiérrez says that the NOC’s refining business is already operating at a lost in some cases and a drop in the final price between CoP$1000-2000 would mean losses for the company around US$1.75B.

Title: How to get fuel prices down?
Headline: The price of fuel has emerged from the ongoing national strike as a central theme for discord. One proposal is to rehash the formula used to figure fuel prices and reduce taxes. Greater user of pipelines to transport crude also arose as a option.
Article: The price of fuel has emerged from the ongoing national strike as a central theme for discord. One proposal is to rehash the formula used to figure fuel prices and reduce taxes. Greater user of pipelines to transport crude also arose as a option.

Title: USO members join national strike for a day

Article: The USO continued to cash in on the general strike which has congested Colombian transit since August 19. Union members from across the country joined the strike last Wednesday, August 28.

Title: Some progress, but blockades continue, cutting into production
Headline: The national strike is into its third week and there are several signs of progress at the negotiating table. However, roads still remain blocked and the first official confirmations that oil production has taken a hit reached the newswire.
Article: The national strike is into its third week and there are several signs of progress at the negotiating table. However, roads still remain blocked and the first official confirmations that oil production has taken a hit reached the newswire.

Title: Getting better all the time – An interview with Luz Helena Sarmiento

Title: Government recognizes trucker strike, to review Ecopetrol fuel prices

Article: After a meeting between the members of the Finance, Mines and Energy and Transport ministries with the Colombian Truckers Association (ACC) the government has recognized the trucker’s national strike and found its demands to be valid.

Title: Cost trend reverses in 2013

Article: Our estimate of the average operating cost per barrel (based on realized oil price minus netback) has fallen for the last two quarters, having demonstrated a long term uptrend over the previous four years.

Title: Petroecuador signs transport agreement with Colombian oil producers

Article: Ecuador’s NOC Petroecuador has signed an agreement with a handful of Colombia oil producers to transport crude from the Colombia-Ecuador border to the Amazonas station of the OCP Ecuador pipeline.

Title: Despite pressure, Ecopetrol still evaluating Rubiales future

Article: Ecopetrol’s president Javier Gutiérrez said this week that the NOC continues to evaluate fundamentals to decide if it will extend or not the concession of the Rubiales field with Canada’s Pacific Rubiales Energy past its current expiration date in 2016.

Title: Equion says strike at Floreña facilities could cost 3,000 barrels/day next year

Article: Oil producer Equion says that a strike of workers expanding its Early Production Facilities (EPF) at its Floreña well could mean losing 3,000 barrels of oil a day from daily production next year if not resolved.

Title: USO calls for Pacific Rubiales to be kicked out of the country
Headline: The USO held another “ethical judgment” session and called on Pacific Rubiales Energy to be expelled from Colombia for what it says are systematic violations of the right to freely form a union and said that it would be setting up an operational commission to specifically monitor its actions.
Article: The USO held another “ethical judgment” session and called on Pacific Rubiales Energy to be expelled from Colombia for what it says are systematic violations of the right to freely form a union and said that it would be setting up an operational commission to specifically monitor its actions.

Title: Pacific Rubiales mulling purchase of light crude producer

Article: In order to reduce transportation costs Pacific Rubiales is mulling the purchase of a light oil producer in Colombia, as it could mix the lighter crude with its heavier product making it apt for pipeline transport and lower costs.

Title: CSR Stories from July, August
Headline: A number of corporate social responsibility (CSR) projects have been completed or announced over the last few weeks which show a more positive side of community and industry relations. Many are too small to warrant a full story, but together paint a picture of how the oil sector’s resources can benefit local communities.

Title: ANIF: Mining-Energy boom could fizzle in 2-3 years
Headline: Colombia’s economy growth is “unbalanced” and slowing, and the increased supply of shale gas oil could tamper the boom in the country’s energy production in 2-3 years says Sergio Clavijo, director of Colombia’s National Association of Financial Institutions.
Article: Colombia’s economy growth is “unbalanced” and slowing, and the increased supply of shale gas oil could tamper the boom in the country’s energy production in 2-3 years says Sergio Clavijo, director of Colombia’s National Association of Financial Institutions.

Title: Opposition to seismic testing in Casanare reaches the mayor’s office

Article: Five Casanare mayors spoke out against seismic testing Ecopetrol has planned for its Odisea 3D project in Casanare, alleging the testing is performed without adequate control and affects water sources and the environment in general.

Title: Pacific Rubiales sees its profits sink as production remains flat
Headline: Looking back a year, production for Pacific Rubiales grew 38% to reach 127,555boed, sequentially flat compared to the 127,889boed produced in the 1Q13. Profits in the quarter were US$57.6M, a 74.3% drop compared to last year and a 52.7% drop compared to 1Q13.
Article: Looking back a year, production for Pacific Rubiales grew 38% to reach 127,555boed, sequentially flat compared to the 127,889boed produced in the 1Q13. Profits in the quarter were US$57.6M, a 74.3% drop compared to last year and a 52.7% drop compared to 1Q13.

Title: Cenit preparing US$800M plan to lower heavy crude costs

Article: Ecopetrol’s transportation company Cenit is preparing a three pillared plan designed to reduce the industry’s costs associated with producing heavy crude as this takes a growing share of overall extraction in Colombia.

Title: ANIF says Ecopetrol should sell 10% share to finance infrastructure investments

Article: In order to finance infrastructure investments in roads, bridges, airports and other items holding back Colombia’s development Ecopetrol should sell an additional 10% of its shares to private investors, says the president of Colombia’s National Association of Financial Institutions (ANIF).

Title: Despite conflicts on the ground, July production hits new record

Article: Average daily production of oil in July 2013 in Colombia reached a new record of 1,020,000 barrels per day, a 14.8% increase over the same period last year, and comes despite a number of strikes, blockades and protests in oil production regions.

Title: ANH Chief: Mexico must focus on investment, become competitive

Article: In the transition from a state operated monopoly to a mixed scenario with private players Mexico must find ways to be competitive globally and encourage sustained private investment in exploration says Germán Arce, president of Colombia’s National Hydrocarbons Agency (ANH).

Article: Striking construction workers involved in the Cartagena Refinery expansion project reached an agreement with the contractor in charge of the labor, CB&I to return to their posts and start negotiations this week.

Title: Ecopetrol crude oil production drops sequentially in 2Q13

Title: What’s in store from the USO in 2013? An interview with Rudolfo Vecino

Title: Looking past pay and supply issues, PDVSA looks to extend Colombia gas imports

Title: 90% of Ecopetrol purchases with Colombian suppliers in first half 2013
Headline: Ecopetrol released purchasing figures which show that just over 90% of its purchasing for goods and services in the first half of 2013 (January –June 2013) were with Colombian companies. Moreover, its hiring of local suppliers grew 46% compared to the previous year, according to information from the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MinMinas).
Article: Ecopetrol released purchasing figures which show that just over 90% of its purchasing for goods and services in the first half of 2013 (January –June 2013) were with Colombian companies. Article: Llanos Orientales (ODL) socialized the construction of a Carmentea-Araguaney pipeline in the Yopal municipality, which will connect a well in Tauramena with Cenit’s Araguaney station in Yopal, and community leaders are wary of its effect on urban growth and alleged lack of local hires.

Title: Gov approves Ecopetrol bonds, looks to push dollar

Article: The Transport Minister Cecilia Álvarez Correa-Glen announced that the ministry will form a technical committee to come up with solution to mitigate some of the problems stemming from oil trucks on public highways.

Title: USO rejects new contracts calling for multifunctional workers
Headline: The USO in a statement says it categorically rejects the model of new contracts that Ecopetrol’s administration is proposing. The union calls it an attack against the workers, as it will allow contractor firms to lower headcount, decrease salaries and hierarchical ranks of works, increase the work load through “multifunctional” workers. This will expose workers to a higher risk of accidents, breaking the internal policy of Ecopetrol called “Work Safely, Clean Barrels”.
Article: The USO in a statement says it categorically rejects the model of new contracts that Ecopetrol’s administration is proposing. The union calls it an attack against the workers, as it will allow contractor firms to lower headcount, decrease salaries and hierarchical ranks of works, increase the work load through “multifunctional” workers. This will expose workers to a higher risk of accidents, breaking the internal policy of Ecopetrol called “Work Safely, Clean Barrels”.

Title: What is the price of community peace?
