Title: Oil firms deny water risk in Casanare due to seismic explorations
Headline: Following reports that seismic explorations in the foothills of Casanare were affecting on local water supplies, even drying up rivers, two of the oil companies operating in the region have said they are completely within the law and the tests are low impact.
Article: Following reports that seismic explorations in the foothills of Casanare were affecting on local water supplies, even drying up rivers, two of the oil companies operating in the region have said they are completely within the law and the tests are low impact.

Title: Ecopetrol Pintuco agree to sell new paint technology to wider market
Headline: Colombian paint specialist Pintuco has reached an agreement with Ecopetrol to commercialize the later’s MCO-R paint technology in the domestic market as part of a technology transfer and innovation program run by the state oil firm.
Article: Colombian paint specialist Pintuco has reached an agreement with Ecopetrol to commercialize the later’s MCO-R paint technology in the domestic market as part of a technology transfer and innovation program run by the state oil firm.

Title: Ecopetrol could award Barrancabermeja Refinery modernization contract in 2014
Headline: Ecopetrol could have the requirements and details of a modernization project of the Barrancabermeja Refinery ready by the end of the year, which would mean it would award contracts to do the work during 2014.
Article: Ecopetrol could have the requirements and details of a modernization project of the Barrancabermeja Refinery ready by the end of the year, which would mean it would award contracts to do the work during 2014.

Title: Tibu protests worsen: Deaths reported, coca farming a fundamental issue
Headline: Protests which started in the city of Tibú, in the Norte de Santander department have turned increasing violent as local mayors are calling on the national government for help. According to reports in the local press, a fundamental cause of the protests is the eradication of coca crops without an alternative crop or subsidies to compensate affected families.
Article: Protests which started in the city of Tibú, in the Norte de Santander department have turned increasing violent as local mayors are calling on the national government for help. According to reports in the local press, a fundamental cause of the protests is the eradication of coca crops without an alternative crop or subsidies to compensate affected families.

Title: Gov draws line in Drummond and Cerrejón gas and coal deadlock
Headline: In the absence of an agreement between mining firms Drummond and Cerrejón over methane gas and coal reserves in La Guajira, the government has said it will step in and impose a decision to break the ongoing deadlock over how to extract the resources which share the same block.
Article: In the absence of an agreement between mining firms Drummond and Cerrejón over methane gas and coal reserves in La Guajira, the government has said it will step in and impose a decision to break the ongoing deadlock over how to extract the resources which share the same block.

Title: Crude export shift to Far East continues
Headline: Every quarter Ecopetrol helpfully publishes the distribution of its crude oil exports. Other producers would have different profiles but considering the NOC’s size both in terms of production and commercialization, this is a good indicator of the country as a whole.
Article: Every quarter Ecopetrol helpfully publishes the distribution of its crude oil exports. Other producers would have different profiles but considering the NOC’s size both in terms of production and commercialization, this is a good indicator of the country as a whole.

Title: Bicentennial Pipeline unveils community center in Nunchia
Headline: The Bicentennial Pipeline unveiled a community center for events and meetings in a village of Nunchia which it says will benefit more than 350 people in the community and is one of seven the company is delivering for community use.
Article: The Bicentennial Pipeline unveiled a community center for events and meetings in a village of Nunchia which it says will benefit more than 350 people in the community and is one of seven the company is delivering for community use.

Title: NGO: Seismic exploration affecting water supply in Casanare
Headline: Seismic tests to explore the eastern foothills of Casanare are allegedly affecting the water supply in rivers and streams and could impact local communities, says an environmental NGO.
Article: Seismic tests to explore the eastern foothills of Casanare are allegedly affecting the water supply in rivers and streams and could impact local communities, says an environmental NGO.

Title: Ecopetrol president: 2013 a year for optimism
Headline: Ecopetrol president Javier Gutierrez looks at 2013 with optimism both for the state oil firm’s prospects position but also for Colombia’s economic and political advances.
Article: Ecopetrol president Javier Gutierrez looks at 2013 with optimism both for the state oil firm’s prospects position but also for Colombia’s economic and political advances.

Title: Mexican energy secretary visting Colombia, interested in Ecopetrol model
Headline: Mexico’s Energy Secretary Pedro Joaquín Coldwell has embarked on a state trip which includes meetings to discuss the business model of Ecopetrol with Colombian officials, as well as attend an energy conference in Bogota and later a trip to Brazil.
Article: Mexico’s Energy Secretary Pedro Joaquín Coldwell has embarked on a state trip which includes meetings to discuss the business model of Ecopetrol with Colombian officials, as well as attend an energy conference in Bogota and later a trip to Brazil.

Title: Parex expects to drill 30 wells in 2013
Headline: Canadian oil producer Parex Resources expects to drill 30 new wells this year in order to continue expanding its production in Colombia and keep with its success rate to date of 70%, the company’s general manager Lee Distefano was quoted as saying.
Article: Canadian oil producer Parex Resources expects to drill 30 new wells this year in order to continue expanding its production in Colombia and keep with its success rate to date of 70%, the company’s general manager Lee Distefano was quoted as saying.

Title: The great gas debate continues
Headline: Recently Colombia’s energy regulator, the CREG, issued an order to UPME — the Ministry of Mines and Energy’s think tank and research division — to look into the importation of Liquid Natural Gas, LNG.
Article: Recently Colombia’s energy regulator, the CREG, issued an order to UPME — the Ministry of Mines and Energy’s think tank and research division — to look into the importation of Liquid Natural Gas, LNG.

Title: Protests in Tibu grind oil activities to a halt, losses mount
Headline: Rural communities in Tibú, located in the Santander Norte department have erected barricades and organized protests which have 90% of Ecopetrol’s oil drilling and extraction activities stopped.
Article: Rural communities in Tibú, located in the Santander Norte department have erected barricades and organized protests which have 90% of Ecopetrol’s oil drilling and extraction activities stopped.

Title: USO: Court ruling attack against union rights
Headline: A Supreme Court ruling against the USO regarding the union’s role in a 2011 strike involving a contractor, CBI, in the Reficar oil field signals a “destructive judicial precedent for the union fight in Colombia,” the USO said.
Article: A Supreme Court ruling against the USO regarding the union’s role in a 2011 strike involving a contractor, CBI, in the Reficar oil field signals a “destructive judicial precedent for the union fight in Colombia,” the USO said.

Title: Each Ecopetrol peso invested in ICP innovation programs pays back six fold
Headline: For each peso that Ecoperol invests in its Colombian Petroleum Institute (ICP), an in-house entity geared towards research and development of new technologies, the firm receives six times the amount in savings or earnings.
Article: For each peso that Ecoperol invests in its Colombian Petroleum Institute (ICP), an in-house entity geared towards research and development of new technologies, the firm receives six times the amount in savings or earnings.

Title: Chamber of Commerce to play role with Ecopetrol, contractors, local suppliers
Headline: The Villavicencio Chamber of Commerce (CCV) will create a mechanism to resolve payment disputes between local suppliers and Ecopetrol contractors and monitor payments from the oil producer to its direct contractors.
Article: The Villavicencio Chamber of Commerce (CCV) will create a mechanism to resolve payment disputes between local suppliers and Ecopetrol contractors and monitor payments from the oil producer to its direct contractors.

Title: Ecopetrol pipeline attacks on the rise in 2013
Headline: Attacks on Ecopetrol’s pipeline infrastructure have nearly doubled in 2013 and as of the end of May, the count had reached 90, a radio report quoted an Ecopetrol executive as saying.
Article: Attacks on Ecopetrol’s pipeline infrastructure have nearly doubled in 2013 and as of the end of May, the count had reached 90, a radio report quoted an Ecopetrol executive as saying.

Title: MinMinas highlights hydrocarbons transport infrastructure opportunities for banking sector
Headline: The Minister of Mines and Energy Federico Renjifo told bankers at a recent banking convention that growing hydrocarbons production in Colombia requires significant investments in coming years, creating an opportunity for the financial sector.
Article: The Minister of Mines and Energy Federico Renjifo told bankers at a recent banking convention that growing hydrocarbons production in Colombia requires significant investments in coming years, creating an opportunity for the financial sector.

Title: USO reiterates calls for greater protection
Headline: Better protection for union leaders has been a resurgent theme and last week was the only issue the USO addressed in statements on its website.
Article: Better protection for union leaders has been a resurgent theme and last week was the only issue the USO addressed in statements on its website.

Title: Bicentennial Pipeline operation puts 3300 trucks offline
Headline: Once fully operational in August, the Bicentennial Pipeline will move 110,000 barrels of oil daily to the expense of around 3300 trucks that will no longer be used to transport crude.
Article: Once fully operational in August, the Bicentennial Pipeline will move 110,000 barrels of oil daily to the expense of around 3300 trucks that will no longer be used to transport crude.

Title: Ecopetrol signs MOU to implement MSAR technology
Headline: Ecopetrol has signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to form an alliance with Quadrise Fuels International (QFI) and use MSAR technology for processing heavy fuel oil.
Article: Ecopetrol has signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to form an alliance with Quadrise Fuels International (QFI) and use MSAR technology for processing heavy fuel oil.

Title: Bicentennial Pipeline lays out contingency plan
Headline: The Bicentennial Pipeline (OBC) met with representative of the Disaster Risk Management of Casanare to detail its contingency plan in order to integrate it with the departmental plan.
Article: The Bicentennial Pipeline (OBC) met with representative of the Disaster Risk Management of Casanare to detail its contingency plan in order to integrate it with the departmental plan.

Title: USO taking Pacific Rubiales to court
Headline: The USO said it has presented a formal lawsuit to the country’s attorney general against Pacific Rubiales and contractor companies for what it describes as anti-union practices and a “violation of the right to gather and associate.”
Article: The USO said it has presented a formal lawsuit to the country’s attorney general against Pacific Rubiales and contractor companies for what it describes as anti-union practices and a “violation of the right to gather and associate.”

Title: Pacific Rubiales rejects comptroller’s claims of environmental damage
Headline: Pacific Rubiales’ CEO Ronald Pantin rejected allegations from Colombia’s Comptroller that the company’s extraction practices in the Rubiales field are causing environmental damage.
Article: Pacific Rubiales’ CEO Ronald Pantin rejected allegations from Colombia’s Comptroller that the company’s extraction practices in the Rubiales field are causing environmental damage.

Title: Inner Circle Monthly Report for June 2012
Headline: The great gas debate has been simmering for a few months now.
Article: The great gas debate has been simmering for a few months now.

Title: Average prices stable but what happened to Ecopetrol?
Headline: The first quarter is strange because some stragglers take the full 90 days they have to report 4Q results and then often are able to file 1Q results early.
Article: The first quarter is strange because some stragglers take the full 90 days they have to report 4Q results and then often are able to file 1Q results early.

Title: What happened to Ecopetrol’s prices?
Headline: The first quarter is strange because some stragglers take the full 90 days they have to report 4Q results and then often are able to file 1Q results early. So we did not publish our price analysis last quarter and have two quarters´ worth of data for this quarter.
Article: The first quarter is strange because some stragglers take the full 90 days they have to report 4Q results and then often are able to file 1Q results early. So we did not publish our price analysis last quarter and have two quarters´ worth of data for this quarter.

Title: Community, municipal reps meet over Casanare roads, point at oil industry
Headline: Members of the municipalities of Munchia, San Luis de Paleque and Trinidad have met with oil company representatives to discuss the poor quality of the department’s roads.
Article: Members of the municipalities of Munchia, San Luis de Paleque and Trinidad have met with oil company representatives to discuss the poor quality of the department’s roads.

Title: Canacol completes the transformation
Headline: When we started writing up company results, Canacol confused us with its production figures broken down between Tariff and Non-Tariff. We expect that shortly this distinction will come to an end.
Article: When we started writing up company results, Canacol confused us with its production figures broken down between Tariff and Non-Tariff. We expect that shortly this distinction will come to an end.

Title: Ecopetrol details its Aguazul environmental compensation investments
Headline: Ecopetrol published the results of its 1% environmental compensation fund required by law, destined for the influence area of the Cupiagua oil field and other zones of the Casanare department.
Article: Ecopetrol published the results of its 1% environmental compensation fund required by law, destined for the influence area of the Cupiagua oil field and other zones of the Casanare department.

Title: USO says more threats have been received
Headline: The USO said that it has received more death threats last week directed towards union leaders in the Magdalena Medio region in a letter it says is signed by the Paramilitary group Los Rastrojos.
Article: The USO said that it has received more death threats last week directed towards union leaders in the Magdalena Medio region in a letter it says is signed by the Paramilitary group Los Rastrojos.

Title: Ecopetrol-Cupiagua agreement costly for the industry

Article: Ecopetrol and community leaders of municipalities surrounding the Cupiagua oil field have signed an agreement establishing the oil producer’s commitments with the local community.

Title: SuperFin wants more info from hydrocarbons and mining projects
Headline: Colombia’s financial regulator SuperFin is preparing a set of norms that will regulate the information provided by companies in the hydrocarbon and mining industries for the general public and investors.
Article: Colombia’s financial regulator SuperFin is preparing a set of norms that will regulate the information provided by companies in the hydrocarbon and mining industries for the general public and investors.

Title: UPDATED: Pipeline attack disrupts transport near Ecuador border
Headline: A Sunday bombing of the San Miguel-Orito Pipeline in the Putumayo department, forced authorities to suspend the pipeline’s use, in an attack that Ecopetrol says comes from the Farc.
Article: A Sunday bombing of the San Miguel-Orito Pipeline in the Putumayo department, forced authorities to suspend the pipeline’s use, in an attack that Ecopetrol says comes from the Farc.

Title: Senator calls for Ecopetrol to assume Rubiales contract
Headline: Colombian Senator Maritza Martínez Aristizábal has tightened her message on the Pacific Rubiales and Ecopetrol relationship, and requested that Ecopetrol assume control of the Rubiales oil field.
Article: Colombian Senator Maritza Martínez Aristizábal has tightened her message on the Pacific Rubiales and Ecopetrol relationship, and requested that Ecopetrol assume control of the Rubiales oil field.

Title: USO takes Pacific Rubiales claims to Canada.
Headline: The USO said last week their leadership made a trip to Canada in order to make ties with Canadian organizations and law makers that can assist the union organize against the Canadian firm Pacific Rubiales. The organization said it met with members of Canada’s Green Party and New Democratic Party, as well as with union delegates of the ACEP.
Article: The USO said last week their leadership made a trip to Canada in order to make ties with Canadian organizations and law makers that can assist the union organize against the Canadian firm Pacific Rubiales. The organization said it met with members of Canada’s Green Party and New Democratic Party, as well as with union delegates of the ACEP.

Title: THX Energy denies link to man with suspected links to underworld
Headline: Colombian oil producer THX has denied any relationship to a man suspected of links  to the Colombian underworld, Gabriel Ricardo Morales Fallón, who allegedly coordinated the use of a company plane for Costa Rican President Laura Chinchilla.
Article: Colombian oil producer THX has denied any relationship to a man suspected of links  to the Colombian underworld, Gabriel Ricardo Morales Fallón, who allegedly coordinated the use of a company plane for Costa Rican President Laura Chinchilla.

Title: Cupiagua Ecopetrol-community agreement still in the air over local hires, fund management
Headline: There is still no community-Ecopetrol agreement over the Cupiagua oil field, where 14 villages within the influence of the drilling are at loggerheads with the company over the distribution of local hiring percentages for the project and the management of investment funds.
Article: There is still no community-Ecopetrol agreement over the Cupiagua oil field, where 14 villages within the influence of the drilling are at loggerheads with the company over the distribution of local hiring percentages for the project and the management of investment funds.

Title: Santos highlights role of oil industry in growth in rosy speech but falls short on substance
Headline: The Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos addressed the attendees of the International Mining and Petroleum Conference in Cartagena on Wednesday calling a responsible and sustainable mining and oil industry “the main financier of the transformation in Colombia,” but avoided some of the sensitive topics industry leaders and investors wanted to hear.
Article: The Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos addressed the attendees of the International Mining and Petroleum Conference in Cartagena on Wednesday calling a responsible and sustainable mining and oil industry “the main financier of the transformation in Colombia,” but avoided some of the sensitive topics industry leaders and investors wanted to hear.

Title: Senator questions relationship with Pacific Rubiales
Headline: Colombian Senator Maritza Martínez Aristizábal has questioned the relationship and awarding of contracts between the state and Canadian oil and gas company Pacific Rubiales ahead of senate discussions surrounding a contract with Ecopetrol set to expire in 2016.
Article: Colombian Senator Maritza Martínez Aristizábal has questioned the relationship and awarding of contracts between the state and Canadian oil and gas company Pacific Rubiales ahead of senate discussions surrounding a contract with Ecopetrol set to expire in 2016.

Title: Comptroller says Ecopetrol and Meta Petroleum Corp Court ruling could cost state US$13M
Headline: The Quifa/Pacific Rubiales/Ecopetrol story never dies! Now the Comptroller General (a kind of Auditor General) weighs in on the March 13, 2012 ruling to emphasize the difference in current WTI prices versus the historic prices, and therefore the Colombian state risks losing US$13M.From a Comptroller General press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia
Article: The Quifa/Pacific Rubiales/Ecopetrol story never dies! Now the Comptroller General (a kind of Auditor General) weighs in on the March 13, 2012 ruling to emphasize the difference in current WTI prices versus the historic prices, and therefore the Colombian state risks losing US$13M.From a Comptroller General press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia

Title: Ecopetrol president visits Bicentenario Pipeline, says only weeks away from launch
Headline: Javier Gutierrez, president of Ecopetrol, made a visit along with company directors to inspect the progress of the Bicentenario Pipeline in the departments of Casanare and Arauca, saying it’s “weeks” from being operational.
Article: Javier Gutierrez, president of Ecopetrol, made a visit along with company directors to inspect the progress of the Bicentenario Pipeline in the departments of Casanare and Arauca, saying it’s “weeks” from being operational.

Title: Ecopetrol, MinAmbiente launch Third Call for Biodiversity
Headline: Ecopetrol has kicked off its third National Call to Biodiversity, and is on the lookout to invest US$2.2M in conservation projects that focus on the tropical dry forest. From an Ecopetrol press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia.
Article: Ecopetrol has kicked off its third National Call to Biodiversity, and is on the lookout to invest US$2.2M in conservation projects that focus on the tropical dry forest. From an Ecopetrol press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia.

Title: Reficar modernization on the final stretch, new budget approved
Headline: Reyes Reinoso, president of Ecopetrol’s Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) spoke with Portfolio.co regarding the refinery’s modernization project. According to the executive, the project is now in its final stage and Ecopetrol’s board of directors have now approved a proposed increase in the total budget.
Article: Reyes Reinoso, president of Ecopetrol’s Cartagena Refinery (Reficar) spoke with Portfolio.co regarding the refinery’s modernization project. According to the executive, the project is now in its final stage and Ecopetrol’s board of directors have now approved a proposed increase in the total budget.

Title: Ecopetrol still has community blockade troubles in Casanare
Headline: On Tuesday, local news portal Prensa Libre Casanare reported that, through the mediation of a delegate of the Ministry of Interior, residents of the Monterrey and Aguazul communities lifted the block on the Cupiagua field, which is controlled by Ecopetrol. According to Luis Eduardo Cardozo, a spokesman for the protesters, the blockade was lifted but the community is still unhappy: “We demand social investment, labor supply and procurement of goods and services,” he said.
Article: On Tuesday, local news portal Prensa Libre Casanare reported that, through the mediation of a delegate of the Ministry of Interior, residents of the Monterrey and Aguazul communities lifted the block on the Cupiagua field, which is controlled by Ecopetrol. According to Luis Eduardo Cardozo, a spokesman for the protesters, the blockade was lifted but the community is still unhappy: “We demand social investment, labor supply and procurement of goods and services,” he said.

Title: Ecopetrol 1Q13 results: general causes or special causes?
Headline: Ecopetrol’s results always grab our attention because they come out first. It is tempting to think of them as a bellwether for the industry if only because of the weight the state-owned-enterprise (SOE) has in total Colombian market calculations. So when the giant disappoints, as it did in 1Q13, it is worth asking the question if the causes are common to the industry in general or are unique to Ecopetrol.
Article: Ecopetrol’s results always grab our attention because they come out first. It is tempting to think of them as a bellwether for the industry if only because of the weight the state-owned-enterprise (SOE) has in total Colombian market calculations. So when the giant disappoints, as it did in 1Q13, it is worth asking the question if the causes are common to the industry in general or are unique to Ecopetrol.

Title: USO says Ecopetrol workers in Meta are on strike this week
Headline: The Colombian Petroleum Workers Union, USO, always goes for the big targets: Ecopetrol and Pacific Rubiales. Ecopetrol is open to political pressure from the President of the Republic on down. Pacific annoys them perhaps because it is less subject to political pressure which is why the union went to Canada to protest. The union says Ecopetrol workers in Meta will be on strike this week because contractors pay workers below agreed wages.
Article: The Colombian Petroleum Workers Union, USO, always goes for the big targets: Ecopetrol and Pacific Rubiales. Ecopetrol is open to political pressure from the President of the Republic on down. Pacific annoys them perhaps because it is less subject to political pressure which is why the union went to Canada to protest. The union says Ecopetrol workers in Meta will be on strike this week because contractors pay workers below agreed wages.

Title: Workers injured closing illegal pipeline valve
Headline: Counts were down to 32 which 10% above the recent average and just slightly below the long term average. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down slightly at 33.5 incidents but the 52 week average was up marginally to 37.1 incidents per week.
Article: Counts were down to 32 which 10% above the recent average and just slightly below the long term average. Our 4-week Moving Average incident count was down slightly at 33.5 incidents but the 52 week average was up marginally to 37.1 incidents per week.

Title: Pacific Rubiales explores spin out of infrastructure investments
Headline: National business newspaper Portafolio says Ronald Pantin, Pacific Rubiales CEO, announced that the company created a subsidiary to manage the infrastructure and transportation of hydrocarbons. According to Pantin, this measure will give visibility to US$2B that currently are not valued by the market and are invested in the Llanos Pipeline, the Bicentennial Pipeline, shares of the Petroeléctrica de los Llanos Company, the Cartagena Pipeline and the Puerto Bahia project.
Article: National business newspaper Portafolio says Ronald Pantin, Pacific Rubiales CEO, announced that the company created a subsidiary to manage the infrastructure and transportation of hydrocarbons. According to Pantin, this measure will give visibility to US$2B that currently are not valued by the market and are invested in the Llanos Pipeline, the Bicentennial Pipeline, shares of the Petroeléctrica de los Llanos Company, the Cartagena Pipeline and the Puerto Bahia project.

Title: HCC stock indices for 1Q13: Ecopetrol down and everyone else OK
Headline: Here we define a new set of stock price indices – Exploration Exposed and Production Exposed – where we exclude companies for which Colombia is only a minor part of their business (like Oxy or Petrobras).
Article: Here we define a new set of stock price indices – Exploration Exposed and Production Exposed – where we exclude companies for which Colombia is only a minor part of their business (like Oxy or Petrobras).

Title: Talisman bets on Colombia
Headline: We have wanted to talk to Chris Spaulding of Talisman for some time now. Talisman’s worldwide strategy has changed considerably over the past year and especially since a change of CEO occurred in September, 2012.
Article: We have wanted to talk to Chris Spaulding of Talisman for some time now. Talisman’s worldwide strategy has changed considerably over the past year and especially since a change of CEO occurred in September, 2012.

Title: Colombia second largest ethanol producer in Latin America
Headline: Newspaper El Nuevo Siglo interviewed Jorge Bendeck, Fedebiocombustibles president, who referred to the advantages of using biofuels and the current state of the sector in the country. According Bendeck, although the government has supported the biofuels industry, it does not stimulate domestic consumption.
Article: Newspaper El Nuevo Siglo interviewed Jorge Bendeck, Fedebiocombustibles president, who referred to the advantages of using biofuels and the current state of the sector in the country. According Bendeck, although the government has supported the biofuels industry, it does not stimulate domestic consumption.

Title: MinMinas says oil reserves up 5.2 percent, gas up 5.7 percent
Headline: The country’s reserve report for 2012 has been much anticipated because prior signals were not very positive. Government officials publicly worried about reserve-production ratios as did the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP). The three of the largest companies (Ecopetrol, Pacific Rubiales, Petrominerales) did not have good years for oil exploration in Colombia. We think ‘Small Oil’ made up the difference. Overall, this is good news but our commentary points out that there is still much to do. From a MinMinas press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia
Article: The country’s reserve report for 2012 has been much anticipated because prior signals were not very positive. Government officials publicly worried about reserve-production ratios as did the Colombian Petroleum Association (ACP). The three of the largest companies (Ecopetrol, Pacific Rubiales, Petrominerales) did not have good years for oil exploration in Colombia. We think ‘Small Oil’ made up the difference. Overall, this is good news but our commentary points out that there is still much to do. From a MinMinas press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia

Title: Natural gas association edgy about issues of supply
Headline: Santiago Angel Urdinola, VP of Mining, Oil and Energy, of national business persons association ANDI gave a speech where he suggested that the country might experience shortages and rationing by 2019. This got Naturgas – the association that represents natural gas distributors, transporters and producers – upset and they issued this press release. Translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia.
Article: Santiago Angel Urdinola, VP of Mining, Oil and Energy, of national business persons association ANDI gave a speech where he suggested that the country might experience shortages and rationing by 2019. This got Naturgas – the association that represents natural gas distributors, transporters and producers – upset and they issued this press release. Translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia.

Title: Ecopetrol accused of not paying its bills
Headline: The USO continues to publish stories that Ecopetrol is not paying contractors (and so the contractors are not paying their workers). This week Ecopetrol workers at the Chichimene station held a work stoppage in sympathy.
Article: The USO continues to publish stories that Ecopetrol is not paying contractors (and so the contractors are not paying their workers). This week Ecopetrol workers at the Chichimene station held a work stoppage in sympathy.

Title: Pacific Rubiales supports children of Cartagena

Subsidiary Pacific Infrastructure is constructing a new crude export port in the Caribbean coastal city. From a Pacific Rubiales press release, translated and with commentary by Hydrocarbons Colombia.
Article: Pacific Rubiales has hooked up with Colombian pop singer Shakira to contribute to the construction of a school in Cartagena. Subsidiary Pacific Infrastructure is constructing a new crude export port in the Caribbean coastal city. Title: Gran Tierra shows positive signals
